translated: Since he has the color of well-refined gold and holds a vajra lotus, and since he is unstained like a lotus, he is a lotus.

original: g-yon bsnyems tshul gyis gzigs mdzad pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yon bsnyems tshul gyis gzigs mdzad pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is looking with a proud gaze to the left.

original: g-yon pa padma'i khu tshur padma dang bcas pas bsnyems tshul du zhugs shing phyag g-yas pa thugs ka'i phyogs su padma'i 'dab ma 'byed pa la gzigs pas na /🔽g-yon bsnyems tshul gyis gzigs mdzad pa //
analyzed: g-yon pa padma'i khu tshur padma dang bcas pas bsnyems tshul du zhugs shing phyag g-yas pa thugs ka'i phyogs su padma'i 'dab ma 'byed pa la gzigs pas na / g-yon bsnyems tshul gyis gzigs mdzad pa //
translated: The left hand, in a gesture of arrogance, holds a lotus bud, while the right hand, at the heart, is seen opening a lotus petal.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is seen with the left hand in a gesture of arrogance.

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par spras //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par spras //
translated: Adorned with all the ornaments.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: The ornaments are the adornments.

original: spyi bor sangs rgyas kun mchog bzhugs //
analyzed: spyi bor sangs rgyas kun mchog bzhugs //
translated: The supreme of all buddhas resides in his crown.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi sku ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi sku ste /
translated: The body of the Tathagata Amitabha is the body of a buddha.

original: de nyid ni mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid ni mchog go //
translated: That is the supreme.

original: spyi bor bzhugs pa ni de'i dbus su bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: spyi bor bzhugs pa ni de'i dbus su bzhugs pa ste /
translated: Residing in his crown means residing in his middle.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi dbu la sangs @328b rgyas kyi sku bzhugs pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi dbu la sangs @328b rgyas kyi sku bzhugs pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: The body of a buddha should be placed in the crown of Lokesvara.

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug de'i phyogs dang mtshams rnams su sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs brgyad bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug de'i phyogs dang mtshams rnams su sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs brgyad bri bar bya'o //
translated: The one called his and so forth. In the directions and subdirections of that Lokeśvara, one should draw the forms of the eight Buddhas.

original: de su zhig yin zhe na ting nge 'dzin bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de su zhig yin zhe na ting nge 'dzin bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Who is that? He says good samādhi and so forth.

original: shar phyogs su rdo rje 'dod chags ma'i gnas su ni ting nge 'dzin bzang po zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su rdo rje 'dod chags ma'i gnas su ni ting nge 'dzin bzang po zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the east, in the place of Vajrarāga, one should draw the form of the Buddha called Good Samādhi.

original: lhor k'i li k'i la'i gnas su ni padma chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhor k'i li k'i la'i gnas su ni padma chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: In the south, in the place of Kali Kali, [it is] called Great Lotus.

original: nub tu rdo rje dran ma'i gnas su ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nub tu rdo rje dran ma'i gnas su ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: In the west, in the place of Vajrasmrti, [it is] called Samādhi.

original: byang du rdo rje bsnyems ma'i gnas su ni rnam par gzigs pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang du rdo rje bsnyems ma'i gnas su ni rnam par gzigs pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the north, in the place of Vajranarti, one should draw the form of the Buddha called Vipaśyin.

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin bzang po la sogs pa'i g-yon logs su ni rdo rjes brag rtsi ma la sogs pa'i gnas su rigs kyi lha nyid bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba padma'i lha chen po dang / padma'i khyab 'jug dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin bzang po la sogs pa'i g-yon logs su ni rdo rjes brag rtsi ma la sogs pa'i gnas su rigs kyi lha nyid bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba padma'i lha chen po dang / padma'i khyab 'jug dang /
translated: The those refers to Vajra-rock-woman, etc., who should be painted in the places of Vajra-rock, etc., to the left of Good Concentration, etc. The Great Lotus-god, the Lotus-Vishnu,

original: padma'i tshangs pa dang / padma'i 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs te 'di nyid bstan pa ni zhi ba sred med kyi bu tshangs pa 'dod pa'i gzugs can zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: padma'i tshangs pa dang / padma'i 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs te 'di nyid bstan pa ni zhi ba sred med kyi bu tshangs pa 'dod pa'i gzugs can zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: the Lotus-Brahma, and the Lotus-Kamadeva-god-form are taught by the words the peaceful, the Narayana, the Brahma, and the Kamadeva-god-form.

original: de la zhi ba ni dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de la zhi ba ni dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: There, the peaceful is the Lokesvara who assumes the form of Mahesvara.

original: sred med kyi bu ni sred med kyi bu'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sred med kyi bu ni sred med kyi bu'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Narayana is the one who assumes the form of Narayana.

original: tshangs pa ni tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Brahma is the one who assumes the form of Brahma.

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs can ni 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs can ni 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs can no //
translated: The Kamadeva-god-form is the one who assumes the form of a god of desire.

original: spyi bor mtsher zhing mgrin 'degs pa //
analyzed: spyi bor mtsher zhing mgrin 'degs pa //
translated: He is the one who is on the crown of the head, who lifts up the neck,🔽and who is the one who is the lord of the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni rta mgo ljang gu'am 'dir ci 'dod pa rta'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rta mgo ljang gu'am 'dir ci 'dod pa rta'i gzugs can no //
translated: This is the green horse-head, or whatever form of the horse one desires.

original: 'dod pa'i lha zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The desired god is the horse-headed one.

original: ting nge 'dzin bzang po la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad phyag mtshan padma bsnams pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir padma can zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bzang po la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad phyag mtshan padma bsnams pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir padma can zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that all of these, such as the excellent meditative stabilization, should be drawn holding a lotus as their emblem, he says lotus-holder.

original: rta mgrin lcags kyu bcings nas ni //
analyzed: rta mgrin lcags kyu bcings nas ni //
translated: Having bound the goad of Hayagriva,

original: chos kyi tshig gi spyan drang bya //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig gi spyan drang bya //
translated: one should invite with the words of Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni rta mgrin gyi lcags kyu'i mtshan nyid 'og nas bshad pa bcings la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rta mgrin gyi lcags kyu'i mtshan nyid 'og nas bshad pa bcings la /
translated: This is the explanation of the characteristics of the goad of Hayagriva below.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa ba lo ki te shva ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa spyan drang ba'i sngags 'og nas bshad pa'i chos kyi tshig gis bzlas shing bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs la dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa ni yang dag
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa ba lo ki te shva ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa spyan drang ba'i sngags 'og nas bshad pa'i chos kyi tshig gis bzlas shing bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs la dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa ni yang dag
translated: Having bound it, one should invite the Bhagavat together with his retinue into the mandala with the words of Dharma, the mantra for inviting below, Om, all tathagatas, look upon me, O Lord! and so on.

original: par spyan drangs pa yin no //
analyzed: par spyan drangs pa yin no //
translated: This is the proper invitation.

original: de nas padma'i rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa @329a * //🔽ni go bar zad do //🔽dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: de nas padma'i rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa @329a * // ni go bar zad do // dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: Then, “the lotus family” and so forth are self-evident.🔽“One should perform the extensive rite

original: cho ga rgyas pa bya ba yin //
analyzed: cho ga rgyas pa bya ba yin //
translated: by the method of the great maṇḍala.”

original: zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i cho gas bcom lda 'das 'khor dang bcas pa dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bsgrubs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i cho gas bcom lda 'das 'khor dang bcas pa dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bsgrubs la /
translated: Having accomplished the Blessed One together with the retinue by the rite explained in the great maṇḍala of Śrī Vajrasattva,

original: chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab ste /
translated: one should seal with the doctrine seal, the action seal, and the great seal,

original: dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur la mchod yon phul la sngon du song ba'i bum pa la sogs pa yang dag par mchod la sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin du legs par blangs nas rang gi snying gar rdo rje padma bskyed de /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur la mchod yon phul la sngon du song ba'i bum pa la sogs pa yang dag par mchod la sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin du legs par blangs nas rang gi snying gar rdo rje padma bskyed de /
translated: consecrate with the consecration seal, offer a welcoming drink, and having made offerings to the previously generated vase and so forth, having taken the vow properly, one should generate the vajra and lotus in one’s heart.

original: phyi rol na gnas pa'i bum pa'i chus bdag nyid la dbang bskur pa'o ;
analyzed: phyi rol na gnas pa'i bum pa'i chus bdag nyid la dbang bskur pa'o ;
translated: One should consecrate oneself with the water of the vase located outside.

original: /'di ni cho ga rgyas pa yin la de byas nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: /'di ni cho ga rgyas pa yin la de byas nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: This is the extensive rite. Having done that, what should one do?

original: padma chen po'i phyag rgya yis //
analyzed: padma chen po'i phyag rgya yis //
translated: With the great lotus gesture

original: padma'i dkyil 'khor la gzhug bya //
analyzed: padma'i dkyil 'khor la gzhug bya //
translated: one should enter the lotus mandala.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: padma chen po padma dang bcas pa bcings la de nyid kyis me tog phreng ba blangs la rdo rje shugs kyis zhugs te /
analyzed: padma chen po padma dang bcas pa bcings la de nyid kyis me tog phreng ba blangs la rdo rje shugs kyis zhugs te /
translated: Form the great lotus with the flower, take up the flower garland with it, and enter with the vajra speed.

original: 'jug pa'i glu len pa'i padma'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i glu len pa'i padma'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Singing the song of entry, one should enter the lotus mandala.

original: padma chen po me tog bcas //
analyzed: padma chen po me tog bcas //
translated: The great lotus with the flower

original: ma yengs yid kyis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: ma yengs yid kyis phyag bya'o //
translated: one should bow with an undistracted mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: padma chen po'i phyag rgya me tog dang bcas pa bcings la dkyil 'khor du zhugs te /
analyzed: padma chen po'i phyag rgya me tog dang bcas pa bcings la dkyil 'khor du zhugs te /
translated: Form the great lotus gesture with the flower, enter the mandala,

original: bcom ldan 'das la yid bzhin du ma yengs par phyag bya'o //🔽dkyil 'khor zhugs nas ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la yid bzhin du ma yengs par phyag bya'o // dkyil 'khor zhugs nas ting nge 'dzin //
translated: and bow to the Bhagavān with an undistracted mind.🔽Having entered the mandala,

original: bzang po las byung gzungs 'di brjod par bya //
analyzed: bzang po las byung gzungs 'di brjod par bya //
translated: one should recite this dhāraṇī arisen from good samādhi.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i cho gas dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i cho gas dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzungs /
translated: Having entered the mandala by the rite as it has been explained, one should recite the dhāraṇī arisen from the naturally pure meditative concentration,

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste brjod par bya'o //
translated: with the words “Oṃ, etc.”, in the presence of the Bhagavat.

original: de nas mdzub mo lcags kyur bcings //
analyzed: de nas mdzub mo lcags kyur bcings //
translated: Then, having made the hook with the index finger,

original: chos kyi tshig gis legs spyan drangs //🔽zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i chogs dkyil 'khor bris la sgo dbye ba byas nas bsdu ba dang mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i rjes thogs nyid la mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyus bcings la rnga sgra ltar zab pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis
analyzed: chos kyi tshig gis legs spyan drangs // zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i chogs dkyil 'khor bris la sgo dbye ba byas nas bsdu ba dang mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i rjes thogs nyid la mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyus bcings la rnga sgra ltar zab pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis
translated: one should invite with the words of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi tshig gis sngags brjod cing bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs shing gshegs par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig gis sngags brjod cing bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs shing gshegs par bya'o //
translated: Having drawn the mandala by the rite explained previously, having opened the door, immediately after the collection and the praise with the one hundred and eight names, one should invite the Bhagavat together with the retinue, and make him come, with the words of the Dharma, the mantra, and the characteristic of a sound deep like the sound of a drum, having made the hook with the two index fingers.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar zad do //
translated: Oṃ sarvatathāgata is easy to understand.

original: 'jig rten @329b 'dzin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i gzugs thams cad ni 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'jig rten @329b 'dzin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i gzugs thams cad ni 'jig rten te /
translated: Holder of the world means all the worldly and transcendent divine forms are the world.

original: de gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ye shes kyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ye shes kyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
translated: Since he holds them all with the gnosis that displays all forms,

original: 'jig rten 'dzin te bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin te bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
translated: he is the holder of the world, the Bhagavat Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: 'jig rten kun mchog ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i gzugs ni 'jig rten thams cad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun mchog ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i gzugs ni 'jig rten thams cad de /
translated: The supreme of all worlds means in the maṇḍala of the Bhagavat, all worldly and transcendent divine forms are the world.

original: de'i mchog ni padma'i rigs kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: de'i mchog ni padma'i rigs kyi bdag po'o //
translated: The supreme of those is the lord of the lotus family.

original: ting 'dzin cho gas nges par mdzad //
analyzed: ting 'dzin cho gas nges par mdzad //
translated: He definitely creates through the rite of meditative concentration.

original: ces bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Meditative concentration is the one-pointed mind of the deities of the lotus family.

original: de rnams thob par byed pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa de las nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes mnga' bas na /
analyzed: de rnams thob par byed pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa de las nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes mnga' bas na /
translated: Since he is the master of the gnosis of definite emergence from those various kinds of means for attaining them,

original: ting 'dzin cho gas nges par mdzad //
analyzed: ting 'dzin cho gas nges par mdzad //
translated: he is the one who definitely accomplishes by the rite of meditative stabilization.

original: ces bsgrub pa'i 'jig rten thams cad kyi mchog 'jig rten dbang phyug 'grub par mdzad pa'o ;
analyzed: ces bsgrub pa'i 'jig rten thams cad kyi mchog 'jig rten dbang phyug 'grub par mdzad pa'o ;
translated: Thus, he is the one who accomplishes the world's supreme accomplishment, the Lord of the World.

original: / de nas de bzhin slob ma rnams //
analyzed: / de nas de bzhin slob ma rnams //
translated: Then, the disciples are likewise,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar slob dpon gyis 'jug pa'i cho ga bshad ma thag pa nyid kyis slob dpon zhugs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar slob dpon gyis 'jug pa'i cho ga bshad ma thag pa nyid kyis slob dpon zhugs la /
translated: and so forth. Just as the master has entered by the rite of entry explained immediately above,

original: de bzhin du slob dpon gyis slob ma bcug la /
analyzed: de bzhin du slob dpon gyis slob ma bcug la /
translated: in the same way, the master should cause the disciples to enter.🔽Having performed the extensive rite for them, the master should teach them the gnosis of spiritual powers.

original: de rnams kyi cho ga rgyas par byas nas slob dpon gyis de rnams la dngos grub kyi ye shes bslab par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi cho ga rgyas par byas nas slob dpon gyis de rnams la dngos grub kyi ye shes bslab par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dngos grub thams cad sbyin byed pa'i //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad sbyin byed pa'i //
translated: The gnosis that grants all spiritual powers

original: ye shes dag ni bslab par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes dag ni bslab par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: should be taught.

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i ye shes slob ma rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i ye shes slob ma rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that accomplishes the great seal, etc. should be taught to the disciples.

original: ting 'dzin snying po 'di yis ni //
analyzed: ting 'dzin snying po 'di yis ni //
translated: By this essence of meditative concentration,

original: sgrub pa chen po gdod nas byung //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po gdod nas byung //
translated: the great accomplishment arises from the beginning.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa'i bzlas pa'i snying po ni ting 'dzin gyi snying po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa'i bzlas pa'i snying po ni ting 'dzin gyi snying po'o //
translated: The essence of the mantra that accomplishes the meditative concentration of all the deities is the essence of meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi snying po de'i bsgrub par bya ba chen po ni 'di'i dngos grub kyi mchog sgrub par byed pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi snying po de'i bsgrub par bya ba chen po ni 'di'i dngos grub kyi mchog sgrub par byed pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The great accomplishment that is to be accomplished by that essence of meditative concentration is the rite that accomplishes the supreme power of this [mantra].

original: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa'i sngon du yang de ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis gnas pas na gdod nas byung ba'i sgrub pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa'i sngon du yang de ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis gnas pas na gdod nas byung ba'i sgrub pa chen po yin no //
translated: Since it has existed in the same way from the beginning, in the good aeon, etc., it is the great accomplishment that arises from the beginning.🔽Sovereignty over all the worlds

original: 'jig rten kun gyi dbang phyug nyid //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi dbang phyug nyid // ces bya ba ni /
translated: The lord of all the worlds.🔽🔽

original: 'jig rten gsum po thams cad ni 'jig rten kun te padma'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po thams cad ni 'jig rten kun te padma'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: All the three worlds are all the worlds, and the Lord of the Lotus Family is Padmanarteshvara.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na 'jig @330a * //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na 'jig @330a * //
translated: Because it is the very essence of that, it is the essence of the vajra.🔽

original: rten dbang phyug nyid do //
analyzed: rten dbang phyug nyid do //
translated: Since he is the very essence of that, he is the Lord of the World.

original: 'dis ni rgyu las 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas bsgrubs la /
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu las 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas bsgrubs la /
translated: This is the proof by way of the designation of the effect in the cause.🔽The explanation is:

original: 'jig rten kun gyi dbang phyug nyid //🔽ces bya ba'i sgras bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi dbang phyug nyid // ces bya ba'i sgras bshad do //
translated: the very sovereignty of the entire world.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: The statement is to be explained means is to be taught.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?🔽The statement

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is made in order.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs kyi rim pas sngon du bsnyen pa bya ba yin kyi dang po nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs kyi rim pas sngon du bsnyen pa bya ba yin kyi dang po nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The sequence of the means of attainment is that the preliminary service is to be performed, but not at the very beginning.

original: bud med rnams kyi nang du zhugs //
analyzed: bud med rnams kyi nang du zhugs //
translated: Having entered among the women,

original: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis lha mo dang khro gnyer ma la sogs ni bud med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis lha mo dang khro gnyer ma la sogs ni bud med do //
translated: the women are the goddesses, the wrathful women, etc., by means of the twelve kinds of worship.

original: padma'i zhi ba dang / padma'i sred med kyi bu dang / padma'i tshangs pa dang ; padma'i 'dod pa'i gzugs ni 'jig rten gdug pa zhes bya bar grags te de rnams kyi nang du tshud pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i zhi ba dang / padma'i sred med kyi bu dang / padma'i tshangs pa dang ; padma'i 'dod pa'i gzugs ni 'jig rten gdug pa zhes bya bar grags te de rnams kyi nang du tshud pa'o //
translated: Padmaśānti, Padma-Nārāyaṇa, Padma-Brahmā, and Padma-Kāmarūpa, known as the “wicked world.”

original: gang yang rung bar 'dug nas ni //
analyzed: gang yang rung bar 'dug nas ni //
translated: Having sat down in any of these,

original: zhes bya ba ni yid dang rjes su mthun zhing 'du 'dzi med pa'i gnas su 'dug pa'o //🔽padma chen po yongs bzung ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid dang rjes su mthun zhing 'du 'dzi med pa'i gnas su 'dug pa'o // padma chen po yongs bzung ste //
translated: in a place that is pleasing to the mind and free from distractions,🔽one should take up the great lotus.

original: zhes bya ba ni padma'i 'dab ma chen po lce la rdo rje dkar po bsam ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma'i 'dab ma chen po lce la rdo rje dkar po bsam ste /
translated: One should visualize a white vajra on the tongue,

original: bzla bar bya ba'i sngags yid kyis bri ba dang / rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la yang bris nas bzlas par bya ba zlos shing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bzla bar bya ba'i sngags yid kyis bri ba dang / rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la yang bris nas bzlas par bya ba zlos shing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and mentally write the mantra to be recited, and also write it on the vajra and lotus in one’s heart. Reciting the mantra, one should meditate that all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: nyin re ci nus bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: nyin re ci nus bsgrub par bya //
translated: One should accomplish this as much as possible each day.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i rim pa 'dis nyin re zhing rang gi nus pa dang rjes su mthun pas ji srid sko bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i rim pa 'dis nyin re zhing rang gi nus pa dang rjes su mthun pas ji srid sko bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by this process of meditation, one should meditate for as long as one is able, in accordance with one’s ability, every day.

original: de bzhin dus dang zhes bya ba ni snga dro dang / nyi ma gung dang / phyi dro dang mtshan phyed la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dus dang zhes bya ba ni snga dro dang / nyi ma gung dang / phyi dro dang mtshan phyed la'o //
translated: Likewise, at the proper time, means in the morning, at noon, in the evening, and at midnight.

original: stobs ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi nus pa dang rjes su mthun pas so //
analyzed: stobs ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi nus pa dang rjes su mthun pas so //
translated: According to one’s strength, means in accordance with one’s ability.

original: cho ga 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: cho ga 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar zad do //
translated: By this rite, etc. is self-evident.

original: de nas phyag rgya bsgrub pa ni //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya bsgrub pa ni //
translated: Then, the accomplishment of the seal.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang las kyi phyag rgya la ni phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang las kyi phyag rgya la ni phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: The great seal, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal are called “seals.”

original: de'i sgrub pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba don gyis sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba don gyis sbyar ro //
translated: The accomplishment of those should be explained.

original: phyag rgya bcings te ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: phyag rgya bcings te ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Having bound the seal, one should abide in contemplation.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings nas de'i rang bzhin ni bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings nas de'i rang bzhin ni bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having bound the great seal of the desire realm deity, one should meditate on its nature.

original: dngos grub chen po nyid thob par //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos grub chen po nyid thob par // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One attains the state of great power.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i dngos grub tshan po nyid @330b do ;
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i dngos grub tshan po nyid @330b do ;
translated: This is the great power of the nature of the great seal.

original: / de thob par ni de'i rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: / de thob par ni de'i rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having attained that, one should imagine oneself in its nature.

original: dam tshig dam tshig mchog gis te //
analyzed: dam tshig dam tshig mchog gis te //
translated: By the pledge, the supreme pledge,

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i dam tshig ni phyag rgya'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i dam tshig ni phyag rgya'i dam tshig go //
translated: one's deity's pledge is the pledge seal.

original: dam tshig ni dam tshig gis zhes bya ba dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings pas bdag nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni dam tshig gis zhes bya ba dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings pas bdag nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the pledge, the supreme pledge, means that by binding the pledge seal, one attains oneself.

original: las ni las mchog phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: las ni las mchog phyag rgyas so //
translated: By the action, the supreme action, with the seal.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i las kyi phyag rgya ni las te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i las kyi phyag rgya ni las te /
translated: One's deity's action seal is the action.

original: las de las mchog gis zhes bya ba rang gi lha'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas bdag nyid kyis thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: las de las mchog gis zhes bya ba rang gi lha'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas bdag nyid kyis thob par 'gyur /
translated: By the action, the supreme action, with the seal means that by binding one's deity's action seal, one attains oneself.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya'i sgrub pa ni sgrub pa chen po ste bshad ma thag pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya'i sgrub pa ni sgrub pa chen po ste bshad ma thag pa 'di nyid do //
translated: The great practice is the practice of the Dharma Seal, the Great Seal, the Commitment Seal, and the Action Seal, which have just been explained.

original: de ston par byed pa sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud ces bya'o //
translated: The collection of words that teach this is called a Tantra.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bdag bsrung ba dang / gnas bsrung ba byas la rang gi lha mdun du bzhag ste /
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba dang / gnas bsrung ba byas la rang gi lha mdun du bzhag ste /
translated: Having performed the protection of self and the protection of the site, one should place one's deity in front.

original: padma'i dril bu thogs nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad par bya'o ;
analyzed: padma'i dril bu thogs nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad par bya'o ;
translated: Holding the lotus and bell, one should perform all the rites.

original: / de la 'dir re zhig dang por phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje thal mo dang / rdo rje bsdams pa bcing par bya'o //🔽de nas rdo rje bsdams pa rang gi snying gar dral bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de la 'dir re zhig dang por phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje thal mo dang / rdo rje bsdams pa bcing par bya'o // de nas rdo rje bsdams pa rang gi snying gar dral bar bya'o //
translated: Here, first, having performed the preliminaries such as prostration, one should bind the vajra-palms and the vajra-binding.🔽Then, one should unbind the vajra-binding at one's heart.

original: de nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i phyag rgyas bdag nyid la dbab par byas la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i phyag rgyas bdag nyid la dbab par byas la /
translated: Then, one should descend upon oneself with the vajra-consecration seal.

original: phyag rgya de nyid snying gar ji lta ba bzhin du dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya de nyid snying gar ji lta ba bzhin du dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: One should release that very seal at the heart in the proper way.

original: de nas dam tshig gi rdo rje khu tshur de bzhin du bcing ngo //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi rdo rje khu tshur de bzhin du bcing ngo //
translated: Then one should bind the pledge-vajra-fist as before.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags bsam la /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags bsam la /
translated: Then one should imagine the mantra to be repeated on the vajra-lotus at one’s heart.

original: de nyid yid la zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid yid la zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting that very [mantra] mentally, one should meditate on the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: de nas rang gi sems bzlas par bya ba'i sngags kyi ngo bor bsams la de dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug dang bcas pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi sems bzlas par bya ba'i sngags kyi ngo bor bsams la de dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug dang bcas pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then one should imagine one’s mind in the form of the mantra to be repeated, and together with the sixteen vowels, one should imagine oneself as a moon disk.

original: de'i steng du yang bzla bar bya ba'i sngags bsams la /
analyzed: de'i steng du yang bzla bar bya ba'i sngags bsams la /
translated: On top of that one should imagine the mantra to be repeated.

original: ka la sogs pa gsal bar bya ba'i yi ge dang bcas pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa de yang bzlas pa'i snying po dang bcas pa las dang po'i rdo rje de nyid 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje padmar bsam mo //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa gsal bar bya ba'i yi ge dang bcas pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa de yang bzlas pa'i snying po dang bcas pa las dang po'i rdo rje de nyid 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje padmar bsam mo //
translated: The yogin who is taming migrators should imagine that vajra in the lotus, with the second moon disk together with the syllables such as ka and so on that are to be pronounced, and also together with the essence of repetition.

original: gzhan dag gis rang gi lha'i mtshan ma dang / de'i dbus su bzlas par bya ba'i sngags yid kyis bsams la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rang gi lha'i mtshan ma dang / de'i dbus su bzlas par bya ba'i sngags yid kyis bsams la /
translated: Others should imagine the mantra to be repeated mentally in the center of their deity’s sign.

original: bdag nyid @331a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid @331a * //
translated: They should imagine themselves

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya'i ngo bor bsam shing phyag rgya'i tshul las padma'i rigs thams cad spros la /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya'i ngo bor bsam shing phyag rgya'i tshul las padma'i rigs thams cad spros la /
translated: in the nature of their deity’s seal, and emanate all the lotus family from the mode of the seal.

original: des gdul bar bya ba thams cad gdul bar byas nas /
analyzed: des gdul bar bya ba thams cad gdul bar byas nas /
translated: Having tamed all those to be tamed,

original: de rnams phyag rgya'i gzugs der yid kyis bcug la /
analyzed: de rnams phyag rgya'i gzugs der yid kyis bcug la /
translated: they should mentally cause those to enter into that form of the seal.

original: sems dpar byin gyis rlob pa'i sbyor bas phyag rgya'i gzugs de rdo rje sems dpar bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: sems dpar byin gyis rlob pa'i sbyor bas phyag rgya'i gzugs de rdo rje sems dpar bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: They should imagine themselves as Vajrasattva in the form of the seal by the yoga of consecrating the mind.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de rang gi sngags zlos shing rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsam par bya ste //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de rang gi sngags zlos shing rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsam par bya ste //
translated: One should recite the mantra of Vajrasattva and imagine oneself in the form of one’s deity.

original: de nas ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva ham zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de nas ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva ham zhes brjod de /
translated: Then, saying “mahāsattva-satva-haṃ,”🔽one should form the pledge seal of one’s deity and say “samayo’haṃ.”

original: rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas sam yo& ham zhes brjod la dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid dang / sa ma ya satva aa dhi tishtha sva m'am zhes bya bas snying ga dang / dpral ba dang lkog ma dang spyi bor byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas sam yo& ham zhes brjod la dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid dang / sa ma ya satva aa dhi tishtha sva m'am zhes bya bas snying ga dang / dpral ba dang lkog ma dang spyi bor byin gyis brlab po //
translated: With that very pledge seal, one should consecrate the heart, forehead, throat, and head with “samaya-satva-adhitiṣṭa-svāhā.”

original: de nas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: de nas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Then, forming the great seal of one’s deity,

original: mdun du sna tshogs padma'i steng du rang gi lha'i sngags kyi mthar yi ge aa dang bcas pa las lha'i mtshan ma bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mdun du sna tshogs padma'i steng du rang gi lha'i sngags kyi mthar yi ge aa dang bcas pa las lha'i mtshan ma bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine the sign of one’s deity in front, on a multicolored lotus, from the mantra of one’s deity together with the syllable a.

original: de nas rang gi lha'i sngags zlos shing rang gi lha'i mtshan ma phyag rgya'i ngo bor bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi lha'i sngags zlos shing rang gi lha'i mtshan ma phyag rgya'i ngo bor bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the mantra of one’s deity, one should imagine oneself in the nature of the seal, the sign of one’s deity.

original: des yang rang gi lha'i sngags zlos shing phyag rgya des rang gi lha'i skur bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: des yang rang gi lha'i sngags zlos shing phyag rgya des rang gi lha'i skur bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the mantra of one's deity, one should imagine oneself in the form of one's deity by means of that seal.

original: de nas rdo rje padma'i lcags kyu ma la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis de nyid du rang gi lha dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang dbang du byas la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje padma'i lcags kyu ma la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis de nyid du rang gi lha dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang dbang du byas la /
translated: Then, with the action seals of Vajra-Lotus-Hook, etc., one should summon, induct, bind, and control one's deity right there.

original: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang rang gi lha'i sngags dang / dri shya zhes kyang brjod la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang rang gi lha'i sngags dang / dri shya zhes kyang brjod la blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should look with one's pledge seal, the mantra of one's deity, and the word be seen.

original: de nas rta mgrin gyi lcags kyu dang bzlas par bya ba'i sngags kyis rang gi lus la bcug la /
analyzed: de nas rta mgrin gyi lcags kyu dang bzlas par bya ba'i sngags kyis rang gi lus la bcug la /
translated: Then, with the hook of Hayagriva and the mantra to be repeated, one should induct one's deity into one's body.

original: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Binding one's pledge seal,

original: sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod do //
translated: one should say, Samaya sattva.

original: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bskyed la sa ma ya stvam /
analyzed: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bskyed la sa ma ya stvam /
translated: Having generated the mandala of light, one should say, Samaya sattva.

original: aa ham dza: h'um bam ho: zhes bya ba dang / rang gi sngags lan gsum brjod la rang gi lus kyi nang du gtogs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur par bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aa ham dza: h'um bam ho: zhes bya ba dang / rang gi sngags lan gsum brjod la rang gi lus kyi nang du gtogs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur par bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: Saying Aham jra hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ and one's own mantra three times, one should imagine oneself as having become one with the deity within one's body.

original: de nas yid kyis legs so zhes bya ba'i sbyor bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi lus la bcug la dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis rab tu bsgrubs nas rang gi lha dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen🔽pos rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: de nas yid kyis legs so zhes bya ba'i sbyor bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rang gi lus la bcug la dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis rab tu bsgrubs nas rang gi lha dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab ste /
translated: Then, with the mental assent, Excellent! all the tathāgatas enter one's body, and one should be consecrated with the pledge seals, and one's deity and all the tathāgatas should be sealed with the Dharma, action, and great seal mudrās.

original: dang po'i @331b rdo rje bcings las bdag nyid de bzhin du byin gyis brlabs la yi ge brgya pas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i @331b rdo rje bcings las bdag nyid de bzhin du byin gyis brlabs la yi ge brgya pas brtan par bya'o //
translated: Having formed the original vajra and blessed oneself in the same way, one should stabilize oneself with the hundred-syllable mantra.

original: de nas dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur la rdo rje padma dang / bdag po dang ming gi dbang bskur ba blangs la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur la rdo rje padma dang / bdag po dang ming gi dbang bskur ba blangs la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having been consecrated with the consecration seal, one should take up the vajra, lotus, lord, and name consecrations, and one should take up the spiritual practice of the vajra of spiritual powers.

original: de nas padma'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bzhis bdag nyid mchod la padma chen po'i me tog dang bcas pa bcings te yid bsdus te phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas padma'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bzhis bdag nyid mchod la padma chen po'i me tog dang bcas pa bcings te yid bsdus te phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, one should worship oneself with the four seal-worships, such as Padma Vajra Weapon, and so forth, and having bound the great lotus flower, one should bow down with a concentrated mind.🔽Then, having taken the three, reality, Dharma, and pledge, one should recite one's mantra three times.

original: de nas de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig gsum blangs la rang gi sngags lan gsum bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig gsum blangs la rang gi sngags lan gsum bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should recite:🔽May I become just like you, O Lord of the great lords of all accomplishments,🔽the supreme lord of the world, the protector.🔽Having recited this, one should practice well, and likewise, having visualized one's mantra on the tongue

original: de nas dngos grub chen po kun kyi mchog / dbang phyug chen po bdag po'i mchog /'jig rten mgon khyod bdag gyur cig / de skad ces brjod nas rab tu bsgrubs te de bzhin du lce dang / rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la rang gi sngags rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub chen po kun kyi mchog / dbang phyug chen po bdag po'i mchog /'jig rten mgon khyod bdag gyur cig / de skad ces brjod nas rab tu bsgrubs te de bzhin du lce dang / rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la rang gi sngags rnam par bsams la /
translated: and in the vajra lotus located in one's heart,

original: chos kyi tshig zlos shing yid kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du byas la 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: chos kyi tshig zlos shing yid kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du byas la 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: one should recite the Dharma words, and with the mind, having made the realm of all sentient beings the nature of the Padma family, one should sit in the center of the maṇḍala of the deity who tames all migrating beings.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag par nyin re zhing bya ba'i sbyor ba zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag par nyin re zhing bya ba'i sbyor ba zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the purification of all phenomena, and practice this for a month.

original: de nas yang bzlas brjod 'bum byas la mthar mtshan thog thag bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas yang bzlas brjod 'bum byas la mthar mtshan thog thag bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, having performed one hundred thousand recitations, one should meditate throughout the night.

original: de lta bus ni 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus ni 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this means one will attain the state of Lokeśvara.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the Dharma-seal

original: de nas phyag rgya chen po bsgrubs na snga ma bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad nas phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya chen po bsgrubs na snga ma bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad nas phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
translated: Then, if one is to accomplish the Great Seal, one should practice all the rites as before, form the Great Seal,

original: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bsgom la mthar mtshan thog thag bsgoms na nang par 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bsgom la mthar mtshan thog thag bsgoms na nang par 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and meditate on oneself as Lokeśvara for two months. If one meditates throughout the night, one will become like Lokeśvara at dawn.

original: de bzhin du dam tshig gi phyag rgya bsgrubs na dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad nas mthar mtshan thog thag bsgoms nas de bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dam tshig gi phyag rgya bsgrubs na dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad nas mthar mtshan thog thag bsgoms nas de bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if one accomplishes the pledge seal, having bound the pledge seal and performed all the rites, at the end one meditates throughout the night and becomes like Lokeśvara.

original: de nas las kyi phyag rgya bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas las kyi phyag rgya bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the action seal should be explained.

original: de bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: de bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
translated: Similarly, having performed all the rites,

original: rang gi snying gar hri las sna tshogs padma bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar hri las sna tshogs padma bsams la /
translated: one should imagine a multicolored lotus from hriḥ at one’s heart.

original: las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Having bound the action seal,

original: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bsgoms la /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bsgoms la /
translated: one meditates between the two moons.

original: mthar mtshan thog thag bsgoms na /
analyzed: mthar mtshan thog thag bsgoms na /
translated: At the end, one meditates throughout the night.

original: nang par @332a * //
analyzed: nang par @332a * //
translated: In the morning,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes like Lokeśvara.

original: da ni yang dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni yang dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, all the maṇḍala rites should be explained.

original: bdag dang gnas bsrung bar byas la /
analyzed: bdag dang gnas bsrung bar byas la /
translated: Having protected oneself and the place,

original: rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor sprul la gal te 'byor pa yod na me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor sprul la gal te 'byor pa yod na me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod do //
translated: Having emanated the maṇḍala of the subjugation of migrating beings with the mudra of the vajra wheel, if one has the wealth, one should make offerings with flowers, and so on.

original: sgo bzhi nas dkyil 'khor lnga pas phyag byas la phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas snga ma bzhin du sdom pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi nas dkyil 'khor lnga pas phyag byas la phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas snga ma bzhin du sdom pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Having bowed to the five maṇḍalas from the four gates, having performed the four prostrations, and so on, as before, one should take up the vows.

original: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal mo la sogs pa nas dam tshig gi khu tshur bcing ba'i bar gyi phyag rgya bcings la thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal mo la sogs pa nas dam tshig gi khu tshur bcing ba'i bar gyi phyag rgya bcings la thams cad bya'o //
translated: Then, having formed the mudras, from the vajra-folded-hands up to the binding of the pledge fists, one should do everything.

original: de nas sarba shuddha: zhes brjod cing 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de nas sarba shuddha: zhes brjod cing 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa nas /
translated: Then, saying sarva śuddhāḥ, one should form the pledge mudras of Ārya Lokeśvara up to

original: lha mo padma'i dril bu ma'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: lha mo padma'i dril bu ma'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Goddess Padmaghantā.

original: de'i snying po yang lan gsum gyi bar du brjod cing aom badzra mu: zhes bya ba yang brjod nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams rang gi snying gar dgrol zhing lha rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma
analyzed: de'i snying po yang lan gsum gyi bar du brjod cing aom badzra mu: zhes bya ba yang brjod nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams rang gi snying gar dgrol zhing lha rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma
translated: Recite its essence mantra three times, and also recite Oṃ vajra muḥ.

original: la yid kyis gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: la yid kyis gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, releasing the pledge seals at your heart, imagine the body, speech, and mind vajras of the deities enter your vajra, lotus, and sun seats at your heart.

original: de nas sdig pa dral ba'i phyag rgyas sdig pa thams cad dral bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sdig pa dral ba'i phyag rgyas sdig pa thams cad dral bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the gesture of extracting evil, extract all evil.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags bsams la /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags bsams la /
translated: Then, on the vajra and lotus at your heart, imagine the mantra to be repeated.

original: de nyid yid la zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid yid la zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting it mentally, meditate on the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: de nas sngar gyi cho ga rnams rjes su spyad la bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngar gyi cho ga rnams rjes su spyad la bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having performed the previous rites, bind the great seal of Bhagavat Lokeśvara.

original: de nas nam mkha' thams cad dang mnyam pa'i rang gi snying ga'i zla bar yid kyis nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sbyor bas zhugs la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rang gi dkyil 'khor bskyed nas 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings te 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' thams cad dang mnyam pa'i rang gi snying ga'i zla bar yid kyis nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sbyor bas zhugs la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rang gi dkyil 'khor bskyed nas 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings te 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should imagine that one enters into the moon at one’s heart, equal to space, by the yoga equal to space, and having generated one’s maṇḍala with the vajra wheel gesture, one should enter, having bound the entrance gesture.

original: de nas rang gi spyi bor me tog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi spyi bor me tog dor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should cast a flower over one’s head.

original: de nas dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang ba'i bar gyi cho ga rnams rjes su spyad la dkyil 'khor de /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang ba'i bar gyi cho ga rnams rjes su spyad la dkyil 'khor de /
translated: Then, one should perform the rite up to taking the vow of the vajra of spiritual powers.

original: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i nang du tshud par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i nang du tshud par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that maṇḍala entering into the moon in one’s heart.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rang gi lus la bcug la dam tshig gi phyag rgyas rab tu bsgrubs nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab @332b la ;
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rang gi lus la bcug la dam tshig gi phyag rgyas rab tu bsgrubs nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab @332b la ;
translated: Then, as before, one should imagine that the blessed Avalokiteśvara enters one’s body, and having accomplished him with the pledge seal, one should seal him with the Dharma, action, and great seal.

original: 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
analyzed: 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
translated: Having performed the great yoga of subduing migrators as taught in the Compendium of Principles,

original: snga ma bzhin du dang po'i rdo rjes bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs nas yi ge brgya pas brtan par byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dang po'i rdo rjes bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs nas yi ge brgya pas brtan par byas la /
translated: bless yourself with the original vajra as before, and stabilize with the hundred syllables.

original: snga ma bzhin du dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blangs pa'i bar gyi cho ga rnams rjes su spyad bar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blangs pa'i bar gyi cho ga rnams rjes su spyad bar bya'o //
translated: Then perform the rites as before up to taking the spiritual powers and vajra conduct.

original: de nas padma'i mtshon cha ma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis bdag nyid mchod la padma chen po bcings la /
analyzed: de nas padma'i mtshon cha ma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis bdag nyid mchod la padma chen po bcings la /
translated: Then, having made offerings to yourself with the twelve offerings of the seal-offering such as Padma Weapon Lady, form the great lotus seal,

original: bcom ldan 'das la de bzhin du phyag byas nas phyag bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la de bzhin du phyag byas nas phyag bzhi bya'o //
translated: and having made homage to the Bhagavat in the same way, make four prostrations.

original: de nas de kho na nyid dang chos dang dam tshig bzung nas bzlas pa bya ba'i sngags lan gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de kho na nyid dang chos dang dam tshig bzung nas bzlas pa bya ba'i sngags lan gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken up reality, Dharma, and pledge, recite the mantra for recitation three times.

original: de nas aom badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod de lha thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod de lha thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, saying OṂ Vajra ĀTMAKO ’Ham, one should consider oneself as the nature of the Body, Speech, and Mind of all the deities.

original: aom sva bh'a wa shuddho & ham zhes brjod do //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa shuddho & ham zhes brjod do //
translated: Say OṂ SVABHĀVA ŚUDDHÔ ’Ham.

original: gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs shing stong pa'i rang bzhin can du bsam par bya'o ;
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs shing stong pa'i rang bzhin can du bsam par bya'o ;
translated: Consider oneself as having the nature of emptiness, like a reflection.

original: / aom sarba sa mo & ham zhes brjod de chos bdag med pa'i ye shes las byung ba'i lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin bdag yin bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / aom sarba sa mo & ham zhes brjod de chos bdag med pa'i ye shes las byung ba'i lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin bdag yin bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Say OṂ SARVA SAMÔ ’Ham. Meditate that one is the nature of all the deities arisen from the gnosis of the emptiness of inherent existence of all phenomena.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma'i dbus su /🔽ya th'a rakta mi dam padma r'a ga to she n'a li pya te /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma'i dbus su / ya th'a rakta mi dam padma r'a ga to she n'a li pya te /
translated: Then, in the center of the lotus of the vajra in one’s heart,🔽mentally write YATHA RATNA MIDAM PADMARĀGATOŚENIĀLYA PITÊ.

original: b'a sha do she sha bi ba'i dhe ta th'a shuddham tri dh'a tu k'am zhes bya ba yid kyis bris la /
analyzed: b'a sha do she sha bi ba'i dhe ta th'a shuddham tri dh'a tu k'am zhes bya ba yid kyis bris la /
translated: VĀŚA DOSHEŚA VIVIDHE TATHA ŚUDDHAM TRIDHĀTU KĀM.

original: chos kyi dam tshig gis bzlas shing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dam tshig gis bzlas shing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: Recite the Dharma Samaya mantra and do a hundred thousand recitations.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi //
translated: Then, for each mantra of all the maṇḍalas,

original: sngags re re zhing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: sngags re re zhing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: one should perform one hundred thousand recitations.

original: de ltar byas na sngon du bsnyen pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na sngon du bsnyen pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it in this way, one will have performed the preliminary approach.

original: yang na rang gi snying gar rdo rje 'khor los dkyil 'khor sprul la /
analyzed: yang na rang gi snying gar rdo rje 'khor los dkyil 'khor sprul la /
translated: Alternatively, one should emanate the maṇḍala of the vajra wheel in one’s heart,

original: 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa nas padma'i dril bu ma'i bar du rang gi snying po bkod la /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug la sogs pa nas padma'i dril bu ma'i bar du rang gi snying po bkod la /
translated: arraying one’s essence from Ārya Lokeśvara up to Padma Ghaṇṭā,

original: snga ma bzhin du snying po gsum brjod cing don gsum bsgoms la bdag ni rang nyid 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du snying po gsum brjod cing don gsum bsgoms la bdag ni rang nyid 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes rnam par bsams la /
translated: recite the three essences as before, meditate on the three topics, and think, “I am the essence of the great maṇḍala of self-taming.”

original: ya th'a rakta mi dam padma zhes bya ba'i sngags lha thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas pa'i rdo rje padma bkod de /
analyzed: ya th'a rakta mi dam padma zhes bya ba'i sngags lha thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas pa'i rdo rje padma bkod de /
translated: Having arrayed the vajra lotus in the heart of all the deities with the mantra “ya thā rakta mi dam padma,”

original: chos kyi tshig gis zlos shing ji srid bsgom pa'i dus su nyin re zhing mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig gis zlos shing ji srid bsgom pa'i dus su nyin re zhing mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting the words of the Dharma, one should meditate for as long as one sees them in actuality each day.

original: de lta bus ni @333a * //
analyzed: de lta bus ni @333a * //
translated: By this

original: sngon du bsnyen pa shin tu yang byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa shin tu yang byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will have performed the prior approximation.

original: de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du dkyil 'khor 'di'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa nas brtsams te bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du dkyil 'khor 'di'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa nas brtsams te bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, for seven days, one should meditate on the three meditative stabilizations of this maṇḍala, beginning with the creation.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor 'di kun du bri'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor 'di kun du bri'o //
translated: Then one should draw this maṇḍala.

original: de la dang por re zhig yo byad thams cad dang ldan pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas la /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig yo byad thams cad dang ldan pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas la /
translated: There, first of all, one who is endowed with all the requisites should perform the yoga of Vajrahūṃkāra in the center of the maṇḍala site that one desires.

original: rdo rje gtsug tor la sogs pa rang gi lus la bkod de /
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor la sogs pa rang gi lus la bkod de /
translated: Arranging the vajra uṣṇīṣa, etc., on one’s body,

original: mi rus kyi phye ma'i sbyin sreg gis dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs bzlog la zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gi cho gas bdag dang slob ma rnams zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi rus kyi phye ma'i sbyin sreg gis dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs bzlog la zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gi cho gas bdag dang slob ma rnams zhi bar bya'o //
translated: one should ward off the obstructors of the maṇḍala with a burnt offering of human bone ash, and one should pacify oneself and the disciples with the rite of a pacifying burnt offering.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du sa yang dag par sbyong ba'i cho ga dang sa yongs su bzung ba'i cho ga rjes su spyad la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du sa yang dag par sbyong ba'i cho ga dang sa yongs su bzung ba'i cho ga rjes su spyad la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: Then, as before, having performed the rite of purifying the ground and the rite of taking possession of the ground, one should sit in the center of the maṇḍala ground.

original: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i khor bor snyoms par zhugs pa las langs nas bgegs bsal ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i khor bor snyoms par zhugs pa las langs nas bgegs bsal ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du byas la /
translated: Having arisen from the meditative absorption of the blazing vajra fire, one should perform the removal of obstacles, and so on, just as before.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang mchod yon dang / las thams cad pa'i chu snod la sngags yongs su bzlas te rdo rje 'khor los 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor mdun du sprul la phyag btsal ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sdom pa bzung ba byas la snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor chen po byas
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang mchod yon dang / las thams cad pa'i chu snod la sngags yongs su bzlas te rdo rje 'khor los 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor mdun du sprul la phyag btsal ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sdom pa bzung ba byas la snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor chen po byas
translated: Having recited the mantra over the five offerings, the water for welcoming, and the water vessel for all activities, one should emanate in front of the maṇḍala of the Subjugation of Mara the maṇḍala of the Vajra Wheel, and having made obeisance, and so on, as before, one should take up the vows.

original: la / de nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig gzung ba snga ma bzhin du ri rab bskyed la /
analyzed: la / de nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig gzung ba snga ma bzhin du ri rab bskyed la /
translated: Having performed the great yoga as before, then, having performed all the rites, one should generate the suchness, the Dharma, and the pledge beings, as before, and generate Mount Meru.

original: ri rab kyi steng du rdo rje 'khor los dkyil 'khor bskyed la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste bdag nyid spro ba bskyed pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i cho ga thams cad byas nas lus thams cad kyis phyag byas la
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng du rdo rje 'khor los dkyil 'khor bskyed la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste bdag nyid spro ba bskyed pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i cho ga thams cad byas nas lus thams cad kyis phyag byas la
translated: Having generated the mandala on the top of Mount Meru with the vajra wheel, one should sit in the cross-legged posture of a hero in the center of the mandala, and having performed all the rites as previously explained, such as the generation of enthusiasm, and so on, one should make obeisance with one’s entire body.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the three meditative stabilizations.

original: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la de'i snying po bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la de'i snying po bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having bound the great seal of Vinayaka, one should recite his essence mantra.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Then, in order to draw the maṇḍala of all the tathāgatas,

original: rdo rje padma'i rigs chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje padma'i rigs chen po //
translated: the great maṇḍala of the vajra and lotus families,

original: sangs rgyas kun mchog bshad du gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun mchog bshad du gsol //

original: zhes bya bas bdag nyid la gsol ba btab par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bdag nyid la gsol ba btab par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that one has supplicated oneself.

original: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / ya th'a rakta mi dam padmam r'a ga to she n'a li bya te /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / ya th'a rakta mi dam padmam r'a ga to she n'a li bya te /
translated: Then, with the pledge seal,

original: b'a sa do she sh'a bi b'i dhe ta th'a shuddham tri dh'a tu k'am /
analyzed: b'a sa do she sh'a bi b'i dhe ta th'a shuddham tri dh'a tu k'am /
translated: Vāsaśeṣā vibhedatathāśuddhaṃ tridhātukaṃ.🔽 Vajroddistamandalothapāyety uktvā, the maṇḍala is lifted and placed in the sky in the direction.

original: badzrod tishtha mandala au tha pa ya zhes brjod la dkyil 'khor bteg ste bar @333b snang gi phyogs su bzhag la rang gi sngags dang / rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas snying ga dang dbral ba dang lkog mar bdag nyid byin gyis brlab la yang phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: badzrod tishtha mandala au tha pa ya zhes brjod la dkyil 'khor bteg ste bar @333b snang gi phyogs su bzhag la rang gi sngags dang / rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas snying ga dang dbral ba dang lkog mar bdag nyid byin gyis brlab la yang phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: With one's mantra and one's pledge seal, one should bless oneself at the heart, forehead, and throat, and again form the great seal.

original: badzra drishti ma ta zhes bya ba mig gnyis su bkod la aa zhes bya bas rang gi rkang mthil gnyis su sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: badzra drishti ma ta zhes bya ba mig gnyis su bkod la aa zhes bya bas rang gi rkang mthil gnyis su sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la /
translated: Vajra-dṛṣṭi-mātra is placed in both eyes, and with a, one imagines a variegated vajra on both soles of the feet.

original: rkang mthil gnyis gnon pa'i ri rab nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rkang mthil gnyis gnon pa'i ri rab nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from the Meru mountain pressed down by both soles,

original: sa gzhi gtan pa la thug pa'i bar gyi sa phyogs thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin can du byas te /
analyzed: sa gzhi gtan pa la thug pa'i bar gyi sa phyogs thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin can du byas te /
translated: all places up to the bottom of the ground are made to have the nature of vajra.

original: phyag rgya la gnas de bzhin langs //
analyzed: phyag rgya la gnas de bzhin langs //
translated: Dwelling in the seal, standing like that,

original: kun du rnam par bltas nas ni //
analyzed: kun du rnam par bltas nas ni //
translated: looking all around,

original: snying bo kun du zlos byed cing //🔽bsgyings pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bskor ;
analyzed: snying bo kun du zlos byed cing // bsgyings pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bskor ;

original: / rdo rje lta bas kyang phyogs dang mtshams dang nam mkha' dang sa 'og dang dkyil 'khor bcing ba dang rab dang dra ba bya'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje lta bas kyang phyogs dang mtshams dang nam mkha' dang sa 'og dang dkyil 'khor bcing ba dang rab dang dra ba bya'o //
translated: One should bind the directions, the intermediate directions, the sky, the earth, and the center of the maṇḍala with the vajra gaze.

original: yang rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i snyoms par zhugs pas langs la bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: yang rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i snyoms par zhugs pas langs la bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa bya'o //

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi phye la gsang ba'i gzugs can gyi dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du spyan drangs nas snga ma bzhin du phur bus gdab par bya'o //

translated: Then, having opened the four doors of the maṇḍala, one should invite the maṇḍala endowed with the secret form, and as before, one should drive in the stakes.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la slob ma lhag par gnas pa dang / lha lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la slob ma lhag par gnas pa dang / lha lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having done everything as before, one should perform the consecration of the disciples and the consecration of the deity.

original: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la mal nas langs la snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor chen po byas nas yang dkyil 'khor thams cad snga ma bzhin du bteg ste /
analyzed: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la mal nas langs la snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor chen po byas nas yang dkyil 'khor thams cad snga ma bzhin du bteg ste /
translated: Then, on the second day, having arisen from bed, one should perform the great yoga as before, and again, having lifted up the entire maṇḍala as before,

original: bar snang gi phyogs su bzhag ste snga ma bzhin du thig gdab pa'i sngags dang / tshon sna lnga'i srad bu la bdag po lnga yongs su blangs la nyi ma 'chang ba'i dus su dkyil 'khor dris byug cing me tog sil ma bkram pa byas la ;
analyzed: bar snang gi phyogs su bzhag ste snga ma bzhin du thig gdab pa'i sngags dang / tshon sna lnga'i srad bu la bdag po lnga yongs su blangs la nyi ma 'chang ba'i dus su dkyil 'khor dris byug cing me tog sil ma bkram pa byas la ;
translated: Having taken up the five lords of the five-colored thread, at the time of holding the sun, one should draw the maṇḍala with perfume and scatter flower petals.

original: dza las mig g-yon dang g-yas su zla ba dang nyi ma ser po snang ba bskyed nas /
analyzed: dza las mig g-yon dang g-yas su zla ba dang nyi ma ser po snang ba bskyed nas /

original: aom h'um tr'am hr'i: aa zhes zlos shing rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje padma las sgrub pa'i grogs mchog padma'i gar gyi dbang phyug gi gzugs su yid kyis phyung la /

translated: one should recite oṃ hūṃ traṃ hrīḥ aḥ, and having mentally emanated the supreme partner of practice in the form of Padmanarteśvara from the vajra and lotus at one’s heart,

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis tshon sna lnga'i skud ba blangs la /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis tshon sna lnga'i skud ba blangs la /
translated: one should take up the five-colored thread with the left vajra fist.

original: dang por sngags kyis sbyangs shing dri dang bcas pa'i tshon dkar po'i nang du spangs la /
analyzed: dang por sngags kyis sbyangs shing dri dang bcas pa'i tshon dkar po'i nang du spangs la /

analyzed: dza:zhes bya bas srad bu grogs po'i lag tu btang la snga ma bzhin du phyi'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab par bya'o // de'i dbus su snga ma bzhin du ka ba brgyad kyi tshul gyis padma 'dab @334a * //
translated: With JAH! one should give the thread to a friend and, as before, lay out the outer maṇḍala.🔽In its center, as before, one should lay out an eight-petaled lotus in the manner of eight pillars, surrounded by a garland of lotuses.

original: ma brgyad pa padma'i phreng bas bskor bas thig btab la tshon sna lnga'i phye mas phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor thams cad snga ma bzhin du bri bar bya'o //🔽de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar sna tshogs padma la 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sku lugs ma'am /
analyzed: ma brgyad pa padma'i phreng bas bskor bas thig btab la tshon sna lnga'i phye mas phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor thams cad snga ma bzhin du bri bar bya'o // de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar sna tshogs padma la 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sku lugs ma'am /

original: brkos pa'am bris pa sku mdog gser btso ma 'dra ba phyag g-yon pa padma'i khu tshur gyis padma bsnams shing dkur bsten nas de la gzigs pa'i tshul gyis phyag g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang de'i mdzub mo sa de'i 'dab ma phye ba mdzad pa /
analyzed: brkos pa'am bris pa sku mdog gser btso ma 'dra ba phyag g-yon pa padma'i khu tshur gyis padma bsnams shing dkur bsten nas de la gzigs pa'i tshul gyis phyag g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang de'i mdzub mo sa de'i 'dab ma phye ba mdzad pa /
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala, on a multicolored lotus, one should place an image of Lokeśvara, either a sculpted or a drawn image, the color of refined gold, holding a lotus bud in the clenched fist of the left hand, resting on his lap, and looking at it, with the thumb and index finger of the right hand opening its petals.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis spras pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis spras pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: padma'i phreng ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar 'dzum par gzigs pa sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa rang gi snying pos dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i phreng ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar 'dzum par gzigs pa sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa rang gi snying pos dgod par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i mdun du 'dod chags rdo rje ma'i gnas su shar gyi padma'i dkyil 'khor du ting nge 'dzin bzang po zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs can sna tshogs padma la rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /

analyzed: phyag g-yon pas rdo rje padma bsnams shing ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa /

analyzed: de'i g-yon logs su rdo rje bsnyems ma'i gnas su de bzhin gshegs pa kun du gzigs pa zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi tshul can padma'i khu tshur gnyis kyis rin po che'i padma gnyis pa bsnams nas rin po che'i padma stsol ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi
translated: To his left, in the place of Vajraratna, is the Tathagata called Samantakusuma, holding a jewel-lotus with both vajra-lotus fists, bestowing jewel-lotuses,

analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'i sbyor bas bzhugs shing /

analyzed: sna tshogs padma la rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs rigs kyi lha //

original: zhes @334b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes @334b gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: de nas 'di rnams kyi snying po ni /

analyzed: phyag g-yas pa gnyis kyi sa rtse gsum 'chang zhing mchog stsol pa /

analyzed: g-yon gnyis kyis zhags pa dang padma bsnams pa /

analyzed: g-yon gnyis na padma dang dung bsnams pa /

analyzed: g-yon gnyis kyis gzhu dang padma bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: hri: padma padma h'um aa: ho padma aa sv'a gra ma h'um dza zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'dir khyad par ni 'di yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: Here is the difference:

analyzed: phyag mtshan rnams padmas mtshan pa yin no //
translated: the hand implements are marked with lotuses.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bris nas phyi rol du snga ma bzhin du rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor bas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo phye la de bzhin du thams cad byas nas bsdu ba bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bris nas phyi rol du snga ma bzhin du rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor bas dkyil 'khor gyi sgo phye la de bzhin du thams cad byas nas bsdu ba bya'o //
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala in that way, one should open the door of the maṇḍala with the yoga of Vajrahūṃkāra as before, and having done everything as before, one should gather the maṇḍala.

original: de nas mtshan pa rgya rtsa brgyad pas yang dag par bstod la spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya'i dril bu dang bcas pa'i sngags 'dis bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad spyan drangs la dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshan pa rgya rtsa brgyad pas yang dag par bstod la spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya'i dril bu dang bcas pa'i sngags 'dis bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad spyan drangs la dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having praised with the eight-syllable root praise, one should invite the Blessed One together with the retinue with this mantra of the summoning mudrā together with the bell, and one should induct them into the maṇḍala.
Oṃ🔽
