analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta aa ba lo ki te shva ra padma ha sta aa ya ti sh'i gh'am /

original: ai me badzra mu dra pa tri dh'a kri shu sa ma ye ba dha ba shi ka ro mi ta /
analyzed: ai me badzra mu dra pa tri dh'a kri shu sa ma ye ba dha ba shi ka ro mi ta /
translated: ime vajramudrapatra dṛśa samaye badhvāśikaraomi taṃ

analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: sho dha ya sarba siddhya ya padmam ma h'a badzra dha ra stvam /

analyzed: de nas 'di'i phyag rgya bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then his seal should be explained:

analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings la mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te ;
translated: Form the vajra bond, extend the two index fingers

analyzed: lcags kyur byas la mthe'u chung gnyis shin tu brkyang ba ni rgod ma'i kha gdangs pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: and make a hook, and extend the two little fingers—this is called the “cakra-mouth opening.”

analyzed: kha bskyod pa'i tshul du bya ba 'di ni padma lcags kyur zhes bya ste /
translated: Shaking it like the movement of the mouth, this is called the “lotus hook.”

original: 'di mdzub mo gnyis kyis spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di mdzub mo gnyis kyis spyan drang bar bya'o //
translated: With this, one should invite with the two index fingers.

original: de nas padma'i gnod sbyin gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bgegs bskrad pa la sogs pa byas la rdo rje khu tshur gyis sgo rnams bcad de /🔽rdo rje bsrungs bas bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs la tshigs su bcad pa dang / sngags kyis bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la mchod yon phul nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas padma'i gnod sbyin gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bgegs bskrad pa la sogs pa byas la rdo rje khu tshur gyis sgo rnams bcad de / rdo rje bsrungs bas bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs la tshigs su bcad pa dang / sngags kyis bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la mchod yon phul nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should drive away the obstructors with the pledge seal of the lotus yakṣa, and so forth, and one should close the doors with the vajra fist.🔽Then, one should guard all the guards with the vajra guard, and one should offer a welcome offering to the Blessed One together with the retinue with a verse and a mantra, and one should accomplish the Blessed One together with the retinue with the pledge seals.

original: de nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab la aom badzra dharma aa bhi shinytshatsa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs thams cad kyi sku'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang 'od dpag tu med pa'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos rgyas btab la aom badzra dharma aa bhi shinytshatsa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs thams cad kyi sku'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang 'od dpag tu med pa'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, one should seal with the Dharma, action, and great seals, and one should confer empowerment with the words Oṃ vajra-dharma abhiṣiñcmi “I empower with the vajra Dharma” and so forth, and with the pledge seal of the body of all Ones-Gone-Thus and the empowerment water of Amitābha.

original: de nas mchod yon phul la bum pa la sogs pa phyi'i mchod pa rnams dang / padma'i mtshon cha la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis yang dag par mchod la padma chen po me tog dang bcas pa bcings la yid ma yengs par aom padma su kham zhes bya bzlos shing phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mchod yon phul la bum pa la sogs pa phyi'i mchod pa rnams dang / padma'i mtshon cha la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis yang dag par mchod la padma chen po me tog dang bcas pa bcings la yid ma yengs par aom padma su kham zhes bya bzlos shing phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, having offered the libation, one should make offerings with the twelve offerings, such as the water vessel, and with the twelve offerings of gestures, such as the lotus weapon, and so forth.

original: de nas phyag bzhi byas nas phyi rol tu gtor ma la sogs sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag bzhi byas nas phyi rol tu gtor ma la sogs sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made four prostrations, one should give the bali offering, and so forth, outside.

original: de nas padma'i gnod sbyin dang rdo rje me tog dang na bza' dkar mos sbyin sreg gi cho gas sbyin sreg byas la /
analyzed: de nas padma'i gnod sbyin dang rdo rje me tog dang na bza' dkar mos sbyin sreg gi cho gas sbyin sreg byas la /
translated: Then, having performed the fire sacrifice with the lotus yakṣa, the vajra flower, and the white-robed one,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das me tog gis mchod la bzhugs su gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das me tog gis mchod la bzhugs su gsol te /
translated: one should request the Blessed One to remain in the center of the entire maṇḍala, having made an offering of flowers to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags kyis mar gyi sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags kyis mar gyi sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred and eight oblations of ghee with the Blessed One’s mantra.

original: ting nge 'dzin bzang po la sogs pa la ni rang gi snying pos sbyin sreg bdun bdun dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bzang po la sogs pa la ni rang gi snying pos sbyin sreg bdun bdun dbul bar bya'o //
translated: For the excellent meditative stabilization, and so on, one should offer seven oblations with one's own essence.

original: de nas yang lha thams cad kyi snying po zlos shing me tog gi dkyil 'khor dbri ba'i dkyil 'khor dang lhan cig tu @335b gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang lha thams cad kyi snying po zlos shing me tog gi dkyil 'khor dbri ba'i dkyil 'khor dang lhan cig tu @335b gcig tu bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the essence of all deities, one should draw the flower mandala together with the mandala.

original: de nas phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sdom pa blangs la de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems chen po bskyed nas /
analyzed: de nas phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sdom pa blangs la de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems chen po bskyed nas /
translated: Then, having gone for refuge, and so on, as before, one should take the vow, and likewise generate the great mind of enlightenment.

original: su ra te sa ma ya stvam ho badzra siddhya ya tha su kham zhes bya ba dang / padma'i khu tshur gyis rdo rje padma blangs la rang gi snying gar bzhag ste /
analyzed: su ra te sa ma ya stvam ho badzra siddhya ya tha su kham zhes bya ba dang / padma'i khu tshur gyis rdo rje padma blangs la rang gi snying gar bzhag ste /
translated: Saying surate samayastvam, ho vajra sidhyaya thasukham, and taking up the vajra lotus with the lotus fist, one should place it at one's heart.

original: rang gi snying ga'i bla ba la rdo rje padma bskyed nas /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i bla ba la rdo rje padma bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the vajra lotus at one's heart,

original: shar kyi phyogs kyi sgor bltas te phyi rol na gnas pa'i bum pa'i drus bdag nyid dbang bskur la /
analyzed: shar kyi phyogs kyi sgor bltas te phyi rol na gnas pa'i bum pa'i drus bdag nyid dbang bskur la /
translated: one should look at the eastern door and confer empowerment upon oneself with the vase outside.

original: rdo rje thal mo khong stong gi gung mo dang / mthe bong dang mthe chung kha phye la 'dab ma bzhi pa me tog dang bcas pa bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo khong stong gi gung mo dang / mthe bong dang mthe chung kha phye la 'dab ma bzhi pa me tog dang bcas pa bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The vajra palms are hollow, with the middle fingers, thumbs, and little fingers open, with a flower, and one should bind the four petals.

original: de nas des me tog gi phreng ba blangs la 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa blangs la rdo rje shugs kyis dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas des me tog gi phreng ba blangs la 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa blangs la rdo rje shugs kyis dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken up the flower garland, one should take up the entrance song offering, and one should enter the maṇḍala with the vajra gait.

original: de ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is it:

original: ka tsi ta aa ti ro tri dha nu au gra dz'i na su ha ri ma /
analyzed: ka tsi ta aa ti ro tri dha nu au gra dz'i na su ha ri ma /
translated: kacit ati roṣadhanuḥ-ugrajānasuharimaḥ

original: pra pa dye si ka p'a dhi tishtha tsa kra dha ra murti sa manta /
analyzed: pra pa dye si ka p'a dhi tishtha tsa kra dha ra murti sa manta /
translated: prapadyasikapādādhiṣṭhaccakradharamūrti-samantā

original: a'a gatstsha bi ni ya tam /
analyzed: a'a gatstsha bi ni ya tam /
translated: āgaccha vinayataṃ

original: ka tsi ta ni so mya sh'anta b'a /
analyzed: ka tsi ta ni so mya sh'anta b'a /
translated: kacitaniśaṃśantavā

original: p'u ra ka ri dam ka mi las ni sya be ka tsitte di batte /
analyzed: p'u ra ka ri dam ka mi las ni sya be ka tsitte di batte /
translated: pūrkaridam akamila-syavekacitte divyate🔽kāmasamayamaḥ prasidhyamahāpadmarādhaḥ.

original: k'a ma sa ma yam pra siddhya ma h'a padma r'a da ho: zhes bya ba dang padma'i lcags kyu ma zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: k'a ma sa ma yam pra siddhya ma h'a padma r'a da ho: zhes bya ba dang padma'i lcags kyu ma zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Reciting this and the lotus hook, one should enter.

original: yang lho phyogs kyi sgo nas padma'i zhags pa ma'i snying po zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //🔽de nas nub phyogs kyi sgo nas padma'i lcags sgrog ma'i snying po zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: yang lho phyogs kyi sgo nas padma'i zhags pa ma'i snying po zlos shing 'jug par bya'o // de nas nub phyogs kyi sgo nas padma'i lcags sgrog ma'i snying po zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the essence mantra of Padma Pāśī, one should enter through the southern door.🔽Then, reciting the essence mantra of Padma Śṛṅkhalā, one should enter through the western door.

original: yang byang phyogs kyi sgo nas padma'i dril bu ma'i snying po zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: yang byang phyogs kyi sgo nas padma'i dril bu ma'i snying po zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the essence mantra of Padma Ghaṇṭā, one should enter through the northern door.

original: yang shar phyogs kyi sgo nas zhugs la yid kyis ma yengs par phyag bya'o //
analyzed: yang shar phyogs kyi sgo nas zhugs la yid kyis ma yengs par phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, having entered through the eastern door, one should mentally pay homage without distraction.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu aom bi shva dha ya tsittam me sarba dharme shya badzra ni zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu aom bi shva dha ya tsittam me sarba dharme shya badzra ni zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, after that, one should recite: “Oṃ, purify my mind, all phenomena are vajra-like.”

original: de nas dkyil 'khor la bskor ba lan gsum byas la bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor la bskor ba lan gsum byas la bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste /
translated: Then, having circumambulated the maṇḍala three times, one should sit in front of the Blessed One

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and say this:

original: 'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
translated: “Great desire, great bliss,

original: rdo rje chen po nor che ba //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po nor che ba //
translated: great vajra, great wealth,

original: ye shes chen po las che ba //
analyzed: ye shes chen po las che ba //
translated: great wisdom, great action,

original: rdo rje sems thogs bdag grub mdzod //
analyzed: rdo rje sems thogs bdag grub mdzod //
translated: grant me the accomplishment of Vajrasattva.

original: yang 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: yang 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: Also, say this:🔽JAH HUM BAM HO: PRASIDDHIM MAM.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: bra siddhya mam: de nas rdo rje chu 'thungs la bdag nyid la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: bra siddhya mam: de nas rdo rje chu 'thungs la bdag nyid la dbab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having drunk the vajra water, one should descend upon oneself.

original: dang por re zhig sa ma ya satvam zhes brjod de dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams bcing ngo //
analyzed: dang por re zhig sa ma ya satvam zhes brjod de dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams bcing ngo //
translated: First, having said SAMA YASTVA, one should bind the pledge seals.

original: de nas aom padma sa yo ta aa tishtha ya zhes zlos shing sems ma rdo rje ma'i sbyor ba byas nas aa zhes bya ba lan brgya bzla bar bya'o //🔽de nas 'jig @336a * //
analyzed: de nas aom padma sa yo ta aa tishtha ya zhes zlos shing sems ma rdo rje ma'i sbyor ba byas nas aa zhes bya ba lan brgya bzla bar bya'o // de nas 'jig @336a * //
translated: Then, having recited OṂ PADMA SAYA O TISHTHA YA, and having performed the yoga of Vajra Mind, one should recite A one hundred times.

original: rten dbang phyug gi snying po lan brgya bzlas nas dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: rten dbang phyug gi snying po lan brgya bzlas nas dbab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having recited the essence mantra of Lokeshvara one hundred times, one should descend.

original: de nas 'jig rten dbang phyug gi snying pos me tog dor ro //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten dbang phyug gi snying pos me tog dor ro //
translated: Then, having recited the essence mantra of Lokeshvara, one should cast the flower.

original: de nas de blangs la de nyid kyis rang gi mgo la bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de blangs la de nyid kyis rang gi mgo la bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken that, one should bind it to one's head with that very [mantra].

original: de nas de nyid kyis gdong g-yogs dgrol lo //🔽de nas de nyid zlos shing shar phyogs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas de nyid kyis gdong g-yogs dgrol lo // de nas de nyid zlos shing shar phyogs nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, with that very [mantra], one should remove the blindfold.

original: dkyil 'khor blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting that very [mantra], one should view the mandala, beginning from the east.

original: de nas 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la ti shtha badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snying gar dgrol lo //
analyzed: de nas 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la ti shtha badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snying gar dgrol lo //
translated: Then, having formed the engagement seal, one should release it at one's heart with tiṣṭha vajra and so forth.

original: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la bde bas bzhin ras dang bzhin yid tsam 'dzum pa'i ye shes kyis rdo rje blangs pas bcom ldan 'das la lta zhing mchu mnyam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la bde bas bzhin ras dang bzhin yid tsam 'dzum pa'i ye shes kyis rdo rje blangs pas bcom ldan 'das la lta zhing mchu mnyam par bzhag ste /
translated: Then, having formed the great seal of Vinayaka, one should take up the vajra with the wisdom of a slightly smiling face and mind, looking at the Bhagavat with a neutral mouth,

original: ji srid bcom ldan 'das kyis mthong ba stsal nas rang gis dngos grub stsol bar mdzad pa de nyid kyi bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid bcom ldan 'das kyis mthong ba stsal nas rang gis dngos grub stsol bar mdzad pa de nyid kyi bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: and one should recite [mantras] until the Bhagavat grants a vision and bestows one's spiritual powers.

original: de nas rdo rje thal mo bskor ba shis pa brjod pa'i tshul du rang gi snying gar bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje thal mo bskor ba shis pa brjod pa'i tshul du rang gi snying gar bzhag ste /
translated: Then, having circled the vajra palms, one should place them at one's heart in the manner of expressing auspiciousness,🔽and one should recite the three syllables.

original: mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad kyis bstod nas padma'i mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhis bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par mchod la glu dang rol mo la sogs pa'i mchod pas kyang legs par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad kyis bstod nas padma'i mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhis bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par mchod la glu dang rol mo la sogs pa'i mchod pas kyang legs par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Having praised with the one hundred and eight names, one should make offerings to the Bhagavān with the four secret offerings, such as the lotus weapon, and so forth, and also with offerings of song, music, and so forth.

original: de nas bdag nyid la dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga thams cad snga ma bzhin du rjes su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid la dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga thams cad snga ma bzhin du rjes su spyad par bya'o //
translated: Then one should perform all the rites, such as the consecration of oneself and so forth, as before.

original: slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga rdzogs so /
translated: The rite of the master is complete.

original: // / de nas slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: rdo rje mchod yon bskor bcings na // snying nas bsam g-yos bzhin gyis ni //
translated: Having bound the vajra-drinking water,🔽one should bow one’s head

original: mgo bos legs par phyag byas na //
analyzed: mgo bos legs par phyag byas na //
translated: and properly pay homage with a mind free of deceit.

original: dngos grub thams cad rab grub byed //🔽zhugs nas dkyil 'khor lan gsum ni //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab grub byed // zhugs nas dkyil 'khor lan gsum ni //
translated: All powers are accomplished.🔽Having entered, one should circumambulate the maṇḍala three times

original: bskor ba byas te 'di brjod bya //
analyzed: bskor ba byas te 'di brjod bya //
translated: and recite this:

original: 'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
translated: Great desire, great bliss,

original: 'gro ba kun kyang 'grub bar mdzod //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun kyang 'grub bar mdzod //
translated: And may all beings be accomplished.

original: de nas dus kyi mchod pa yis //
analyzed: de nas dus kyi mchod pa yis //
translated: Then, with the offering of time,

original: bde ba chen po yang dag mchod //
analyzed: bde ba chen po yang dag mchod //
translated: Great bliss is truly offered.

original: de bzhin padma'i dbang bskur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin padma'i dbang bskur zhing //
translated: Likewise, the lotus empowerment is conferred,

original: slob ma blangs te 'jug par bya //
analyzed: slob ma blangs te 'jug par bya //
translated: And the disciple is taken and made to enter.

original: de nas slob ma bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yongs su bzung ba'am /
analyzed: de nas slob ma bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yongs su bzung ba'am /
translated: Then, the disciple should take up the five bases of training,

original: dge tshul lam dge slong gi sdom pa yongs su bzung la /
analyzed: dge tshul lam dge slong gi sdom pa yongs su bzung la /
translated: Or take up the vows of a novice or fully ordained monk,

original: rig pa'i sdom pa don du gnyer bas slob dpon la phyag byas la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: rig pa'i sdom pa don du gnyer bas slob dpon la phyag byas la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o /
translated: And, desiring the vow of knowledge, should bow to the master and say this:

original: @336b dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa bas //
analyzed: @336b dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa bas //
translated: “Great joy, you are my teacher;

original: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //
translated: Master, please consider me.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bstan pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bstan pa //

translated: In the same way, one should imagine that the one to be benefited is pervaded by noble Avalokiteśvara, beginning with the head and ending with the soles of the feet.

original: rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du khyab par bsam zhing dug gi skyes bu nag por skyes la zhon pa lta bu zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i lus las bros par bsam par byas te de lta bus ni dug gi nad gso ba yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du khyab par bsam zhing dug gi skyes bu nag por skyes la zhon pa lta bu zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i lus las bros par bsam par byas te de lta bus ni dug gi nad gso ba yin no //
translated: One should imagine that the person of poison flees from the body of the one to be benefited. In this way, one cures the illness of poison.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la 'jig rten dbang phyug bcug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la 'jig rten dbang phyug bcug ste /
translated: In the same way, one should imagine that Lokeśvara enters the body of the one to be benefited.

original: bsgrub par bya ba 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur par bsam par byas te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur par bsam par byas te /
translated: One should imagine that the one to be benefited becomes Lokeśvara.

original: de lta bus ni mdze dang 'brum bu phra mo dang / g-yan pa dang / rkang shu dang / skran dang / chu'i dmu rdzing dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / sha bkra dang / zad byed dang / khrag zad pa dang / khu ba zad pa dang /
analyzed: de lta bus ni mdze dang 'brum bu phra mo dang / g-yan pa dang / rkang shu dang / skran dang / chu'i dmu rdzing dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / sha bkra dang / zad byed dang / khrag zad pa dang / khu ba zad pa dang /
translated: By this, leprosy, smallpox, scabs, itching, blisters, tumors, dropsy, fistula, leucoderma, consumption, blood disorders, semen disorders,

original: nad thams cad dang / gnod pa dang / gdon dang / phra men ma rnams gso bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nad thams cad dang / gnod pa dang / gdon dang / phra men ma rnams gso bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: all diseases, harms, spirits, and rākṣasīs are cured.

original: de ltar padma chen po sman gyi phyag rgya 'dzin pa las sgrub par gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar padma chen po sman gyi phyag rgya 'dzin pa las sgrub par gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the accomplishment from the great lotus holding the medicine seal,

original: da ni thams cad rdo rjer bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma chen pos thams cad bsrung ba'i las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni thams cad rdo rjer bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma chen pos thams cad bsrung ba'i las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: now, beginning with “all vajra activities,” the great lotus teaches the activity of protecting all.

original: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, its characteristics will be explained.

original: bsam pas bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: bsam pas bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: “One should protect with the mind” means this:

original: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor byas la de kho na nyid dang chos dang dam tshig bzung ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor byas la de kho na nyid dang chos dang dam tshig bzung ste /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of Vajra Lokeśvara, and having taken up reality, the Dharma, and the commitments,

original: padma chen po bcings la 'jig rten dbang phyug bsgom pa'i snying po zlos shing thams cad rdo rjer bya ba'i bsam pas @338b thams cad rdo rjer byas pa'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma chen po bcings la 'jig rten dbang phyug bsgom pa'i snying po zlos shing thams cad rdo rjer bya ba'i bsam pas @338b thams cad rdo rjer byas pa'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one should bind the great lotus, and while reciting the essence of the meditation on Lokeśvara, one should imagine that everything is made of vajra, and one will be protected by having made everything into vajra.

original: sbyor ba snga ma dang phyi ma thams cad la sgom pa'i snying po bzlas nas las 'grub par 'gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba snga ma dang phyi ma thams cad la sgom pa'i snying po bzlas nas las 'grub par 'gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in all the former and later procedures, the rites will be accomplished by reciting the essence of the meditation.

original: de bzhin du thams cad byas nas chos skyed pa'i bsam bas ni chos kyis bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad byas nas chos skyed pa'i bsam bas ni chos kyis bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, having done everything, one should imagine that one is protected by the Dharma by the thought of generating the Dharma.

original: cho ga skyed pa'i bsam pas ni cho ga'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga skyed pa'i bsam pas ni cho ga'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should imagine that one is protected by the rite by the thought of generating the rite.

original: de bzhin du gtsug tor dang gtsug phud dang / mtshams dang phyogs dang dkyil 'khor dang sa dang nam mkha' dang rdo rje'i gdan dang khang ba chen po dang / rdo rje rab dang / me 'bar ba dang / thal ba'i ra ba dang / rdo rje dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug tor dang gtsug phud dang / mtshams dang phyogs dang dkyil 'khor dang sa dang nam mkha' dang rdo rje'i gdan dang khang ba chen po dang / rdo rje rab dang / me 'bar ba dang / thal ba'i ra ba dang / rdo rje dang /
translated: Likewise, the crown protuberance, the topknot, the intermediate directions, the directions, the maṇḍala, the earth, the sky, the vajra seat, the great palace, the vajra ground, the blazing fire, the ring of ashes, the vajra,

original: ri bo don yod pa la sogs pa dang ; srad bus yongs su bskor ba dang / phur bus gdab pa dang / zas dang btung ba dang gos dang rgyan dang phyag rgya dang / bsrung ba bskyed pa'i bsam pas de dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bo don yod pa la sogs pa dang ; srad bus yongs su bskor ba dang / phur bus gdab pa dang / zas dang btung ba dang gos dang rgyan dang phyag rgya dang / bsrung ba bskyed pa'i bsam pas de dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: the mountain of existence, and so forth, the complete circle of thread, the placement of the kīlas, the food, drink, clothing, ornaments, seals, and the intention to generate protection—these are the great lotus.

original: de ltar padma chen po thams cad srung bas las thams cad 'grub par gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar padma chen po thams cad srung bas las thams cad 'grub par gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that all activities are accomplished by the protection of the great lotus,

original: da ni tshe dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa padma chen po mchog grub pas las sgrub pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni tshe dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa padma chen po mchog grub pas las sgrub pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: now, beginning with “life” and so forth, he teaches the accomplishment of activities by the accomplishment of the supreme great lotus.

original: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, its characteristics will be explained.

original: rnam par spyang bar bya'o zhes bya bas bsgrub po zhes bya ba 'dis don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par spyang bar bya'o zhes bya bas bsgrub po zhes bya ba 'dis don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This passage teaches the following.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sbyor ba byas la de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig bzung nas padma chen po bcings te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sbyor ba byas la de kho na nyid dang / chos dang dam tshig bzung nas padma chen po bcings te /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of Lokesvara, take up reality, the Dharma, and the commitments, and bind the great lotus.

original: bdag nyid kyi bcing ba'i 'jigs pa la sogs rnam par spyang bar bya'o zhes bya bas bsam pa skyed la sgom pa'i snying po zlos shing bdag nyid 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa'i tshe dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bcing ba'i 'jigs pa la sogs rnam par spyang bar bya'o zhes bya bas bsam pa skyed la sgom pa'i snying po zlos shing bdag nyid 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa'i tshe dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu
translated: One should generate the thought I will purify the fear of bondage and so on of myself and others and, reciting the essence of meditation, one should imagine oneself as the noble Avalokitesvara and so on.

original: bsams te / de lta bus ni tshe 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams te / de lta bus ni tshe 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, one will accomplish longevity.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi kha dog dang ldan par bsams na de lta bus ni kha dog 'grub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi kha dog dang ldan par bsams na de lta bus ni kha dog 'grub bo //
translated: Similarly, if one imagines oneself as Lokesvara, possessing the color of Lokesvara, by this one will accomplish color.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur cing //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur cing //
translated: Likewise, one should become Avalokiteśvara,

original: de'i stobs dang ldan pas bsams na /
analyzed: de'i stobs dang ldan pas bsams na /
translated: and, having become so, one should imagine that one has his power.

original: de lta bus ni bden pa'i stobs 'grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bus ni bden pa'i stobs 'grub bo //
translated: In this way, the power of truth is accomplished.

original: de bzhin du thams cad byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad byas la /
translated: In the same way, one should do everything,

original: bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur cing 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzi brjid dang ldan par bsams na /🔽gzi brjid grub bo //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug tu gyur cing 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzi brjid dang ldan par bsams na / gzi brjid grub bo //
translated: and, having become Avalokiteśvara, one should imagine that one has the splendor of Avalokiteśvara.
In this way, splendor is accomplished.

original: bzhin du de'i mdangs dang / lang tsho dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / nad med pa dang / dpal dang / skal ba bzang po dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / dbang phyug dang / 'byor ba dang / dngos grub dang /
analyzed: bzhin du de'i mdangs dang / lang tsho dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / nad med pa dang / dpal dang / skal ba bzang po dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / dbang phyug dang / 'byor ba dang / dngos grub dang /
translated: In the same way, one should apply this to the accomplishment of his radiance, youthfulness, vigor, enthusiasm, health, glory, good fortune, wealth, grain, sovereignty, affluence, and success.

original: 'phel ba dang / blo dang / rnyed pa dang / bkra shis dang / ming dang / grags pa dang / snyan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dam pa 'grub pa la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / blo dang / rnyed pa dang / bkra shis dang / ming dang / grags pa dang / snyan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dam pa 'grub pa la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this to the increase of intelligence, gain, auspiciousness, name, fame, renown, meditative absorption, and the highest insight.

original: chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na thams cad de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dang padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na thams cad de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dang padma'i rigs so //
translated: Since it is a phenomenon and also everything, it is everything, i.e., the mind and mental factors that have the nature of the perfection of wisdom and the lotus family.

original: de rnams kyi sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The unobstructed pristine consciousness of those is the natural purity of all phenomena.

original: de las byung ba'i padma'i rigs ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i padma'i rigs ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje'o //
translated: The lotus family that arises from that is a vajra because it is like a vajra, since it is indivisible.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The assembly of sounds that teach that are constant.

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba dang / ston par byed pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba dang / ston par byed pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: That itself is the means of accomplishment and the means of teaching.

original: de'i rgyas pa ni rgyun no //
analyzed: de'i rgyas pa ni rgyun no //
translated: Its continuity is the stream.

original: dpal mchog dang po'i rgya cher bshad pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba dum bu gnyis pa'i rtog pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i rgyud kyi rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rtog pa bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i rgya cher bshad pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba dum bu gnyis pa'i rtog pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i rgyud kyi rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rtog pa bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the chapter on Subduing Migrations from the Root Tantra of the Two Segments, called the Arising of the Perfection of Wisdom, the extensive explanation of the glorious Supreme Original Buddha, is complete.

original: // / de ltar log par lta ba'i gnyen por gyur par 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gsungs nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar log par lta ba'i gnyen por gyur par 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gsungs nas /
translated: Having thus taught the mandala of Subduing Migrations, which is the antidote to wrong views,🔽now,

original: da ni / de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: da ni / de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: the king Vajradhara

original: thams cad nam mkha' mi 'gyur che //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha' mi 'gyur che //
translated: is all space, the great unchanging,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ser sna'i gnyen por gyur pa nor bu'i rigs gsungs pa yin no//
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ser sna'i gnyen por gyur pa nor bu'i rigs gsungs pa yin no//
translated: and so forth, teaches the jewel family, which is the antidote to miserliness.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The word “then” is a term indicating what has just passed.

original: dang por sbyor ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: dang por sbyor ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: It is immediately after the first application.

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the first application is just as it is explained in the great mandala of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: thams cad nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyang yin la nam mkha' yang yin pas na thams cad nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyang yin la nam mkha' yang yin pas na thams cad nam mkha' ste /
translated: All is space means that all is space.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dang nor bu'i rigs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dang nor bu'i rigs so //
translated: The mind and mental factors and the jewel family have the nature of the gnosis that is equal to space.

original: de 'di la mnga' bas na thams cad nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de 'di la mnga' bas na thams cad nam mkha'o //
translated: Since he possesses all of this, he is all space.

original: nam mkha' thams cad yin pa nyid kyis na mi 'gyur che ste brtan @339b zhing rtag pa'o //🔽thams cad dbang bskur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba thams cad ni nor bu'i rigs yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' thams cad yin pa nyid kyis na mi 'gyur che ste brtan @339b zhing rtag pa'o // thams cad dbang bskur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba thams cad ni nor bu'i rigs yin te /
translated: Since he is all space, he is unchanging greatness, stable and permanent.🔽All consecration means that all consecrations of all tathagatas are the jewel family.

original: de ltar na de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gdul bya rnams kyi don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pas na kun gyi don te nor bu'i rigs la sogs pa thams cad kyi don nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pas kyang kun gyi don to
analyzed: de ltar na de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gdul bya rnams kyi don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pas na kun gyi don te nor bu'i rigs la sogs pa thams cad kyi don nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pas kyang kun gyi don to
translated: Thus, he is the aim of all, since he is the aim of all tathagatas and disciples. He is the aim of all because he is the nature of the aim of all, such as the jewel family.

original: // kun dbang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la dbang thob pas na kun dbang ngo //
analyzed: // kun dbang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la dbang thob pas na kun dbang ngo //
translated: The lord of all is the lord of all, since he has attained mastery over all mundane and supramundane perfections by the power of the sky-treasury meditative stabilization.

original: rin po che thams cad 'dzin zhes bya ba la rin po che thams cad ni rin po che'i rigs te de thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na rin chen thams cad 'dzin no //
analyzed: rin po che thams cad 'dzin zhes bya ba la rin po che thams cad ni rin po che'i rigs te de thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na rin chen thams cad 'dzin no //
translated: The holder of all jewels is the holder of all jewels, since he holds them by the nature of his own body by the method of comprehending the jewel-family, all jewels.

original: de lta bus ni rdo rje 'chang dbang ba nam mkha' nyid du gyur to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bus ni rdo rje 'chang dbang ba nam mkha' nyid du gyur to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, Vajradhara became the sky itself, is to be supplied.

original: ci zhig mdzad nas she na ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas she na ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What did he do? He said, By meditative stabilization... and so on.

original: ji ltar padma dmar po'i 'od //
analyzed: ji ltar padma dmar po'i 'od //
translated: Just as a red lotus

original: 'dam gyi nyes pas mi gos pa //
analyzed: 'dam gyi nyes pas mi gos pa //
translated: is not soiled by the faults of the mud,

original: de bzhin khams gsum dag pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin khams gsum dag pa ni //
translated: so the pure three realms

original: gnas kyi nyes pas mi gos so //
analyzed: gnas kyi nyes pas mi gos so //
translated: are not soiled by the faults of the abode.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i snying po 'di'i don chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shin tu lhag par yang byin gyis brlabs pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i snying po 'di'i don chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shin tu lhag par yang byin gyis brlabs pas na /
translated: By the samadhi of the natural purity of all phenomena, he is also greatly blessed.

original: rang byin rlabs zhes bya ba ste brtan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang byin rlabs zhes bya ba ste brtan par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called “self-blessed,” and he is made firm.

original: dag pa chen pos rab sad mdzad //
analyzed: dag pa chen pos rab sad mdzad //
translated: He is awakened by great purity.

original: ces bya ba ni padma'i 'dab ma dbye ba sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag po chen pos rab tu sad par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni padma'i 'dab ma dbye ba sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag po chen pos rab tu sad par mdzad pas so //
translated: This means that he is awakened by the great lord who has the nature of meditating on the opening of the lotus petals.

original: chos rnams la ni rnam gzigs pas //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni rnam gzigs pas //
translated: He is the seer of all phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams la rnam par gzigs shing so sor rtog par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams la rnam par gzigs shing so sor rtog par mdzad pas so //
translated: This means that he sees and individually cognizes the phenomena of mind and mental factors that have the nature of the lotus family and the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir nam mkha' nyid du gyur pa yin zhe na kun gyi dbang don zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nam mkha' nyid du gyur pa yin zhe na kun gyi dbang don zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Why is he space itself? It is said, “the meaning of the power of all.”

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad dang bdag nyid dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug rab tu grub pa'i don ni kun don dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad dang bdag nyid dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug rab tu grub pa'i don ni kun don dbang phyug go //
translated: The meaning of the word “lord” is that he is the lord of all the realms of sentient beings, of himself, of the worldly and transcendent sovereignties.

original: nam mkha' nyid du gyur pa de yang khyab pa ji lta bu zhe na /🔽gdod nas byung zhes bya ba gsungs te sngar sgra @340a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid du gyur pa de yang khyab pa ji lta bu zhe na / gdod nas byung zhes bya ba gsungs te sngar sgra @340a * //
translated: How is it that he is the very essence of space?🔽He is said to be “primordially arisen,” because he is the essence of the present, as previously explained.

original: bshad pa'i tshul gyis da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo bzhugs pas na gdod nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshul gyis da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo bzhugs pas na gdod nas byung ba'o //
translated: He is “primordially arisen” because he abides as the essence of the present.🔽How is it that he is the very essence of space?

original: nam mkha' nyid du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid ni nam mkha' nyid de /
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid ni nam mkha' nyid de /
translated: The essence of space is space itself.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa'i tshul gyis nam mkha'i 'od zer gyi rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa'i tshul gyis nam mkha'i 'od zer gyi rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: In the manner in which it is known in the world, he is the very essence of the light rays of space.

original: nam mkha' nyid de khyab par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid de khyab par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that he pervades the very essence of space?

original: nyi zla dang ni gza' skar can //
analyzed: nyi zla dang ni gza' skar can //
translated: He is the sun, the moon, and the stars.

original: zhes bya ba smos te nam mkha' gang la nyi ma dang zla ba dang gza' dang skar ma yod par 'jig rten na grags pa'i nam mkha' nyid du gyur pas na nyi zla dang gza' skar dang bcas pa'i nam mkhar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te nam mkha' gang la nyi ma dang zla ba dang gza' dang skar ma yod par 'jig rten na grags pa'i nam mkha' nyid du gyur pas na nyi zla dang gza' skar dang bcas pa'i nam mkhar gyur pa yin no //
translated: The space that is renowned in the world as having the sun, moon, planets, and stars is the space that is the nature of the sun, moon, planets, and stars.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i sgom pa'i stobs kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma can gyi nam mkha' dang gcig tu gyur pa'i rjes thogs nyid la sgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i sgom pa'i stobs kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma can gyi nam mkha' dang gcig tu gyur pa'i rjes thogs nyid la sgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi
translated: Then, immediately after the Great Vajradhara became one with the space that has the sun, moon, and stars through the power of meditation that was just explained, the nature of meditation

original: shes rab kyi mthar thug pa las byung ba'i nges pa'i mchog gis rdo rje rin chen gyi rnam par thugs rtse gcig pa nyid kyis rdo rje mdzad cing mi phyed pa nyid du mdzad nas de nas yang nam mkha'i rdo rje de las rin chen du gyur pa'i
analyzed: shes rab kyi mthar thug pa las byung ba'i nges pa'i mchog gis rdo rje rin chen gyi rnam par thugs rtse gcig pa nyid kyis rdo rje mdzad cing mi phyed pa nyid du mdzad nas de nas yang nam mkha'i rdo rje de las rin chen du gyur pa'i
translated: is the supreme ascertainment that arises from the culmination of wisdom. With one-pointed mind, he made the vajra and made it indivisible. Then, from that vajra space, he became a jewel.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las bee d'urya sngon po 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni mdog sngo ljang ngo //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las bee d'urya sngon po 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni mdog sngo ljang ngo //
translated: The blue beryl is the color of the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: nam mkha'i snying po ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sku'i yang dag 'byung ba ni de ltar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sku'i yang dag 'byung ba ni de ltar 'byung ba'o //
translated: The great bodhisattva Akasagarbha's body is the source of the gem.

original: rdo rje rin chen bsnams pa ni nor bu rin po che bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen bsnams pa ni nor bu rin po che bsnams pa'o //
translated: The vajra-gem is the gem-holder.

original: dge ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par byang ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par byang ba'o //
translated: The virtuous is the purification of the afflictions along with their traces.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then means immediately after that.

original: bcom ldan 'das thog ma 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i nam mkha'i snying po ni bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thog ma 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i nam mkha'i snying po ni bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Blessed One is the one who has conquered the four demons, and is the one just explained, Akasagarbha.

original: da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis rtag tu zhugs pas na thog ma'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis rtag tu zhugs pas na thog ma'o //
translated: The beginning is the one who is always engaged in the present mode.

original: mdzod spu kun gyi gnas na bzhugs //
analyzed: mdzod spu kun gyi gnas na bzhugs //
translated: The forehead is the place of all.🔽 The dwelling is the abode.

original: zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi skyes bu chen po'i mdzod spu ni mdzod spu kun no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi skyes bu chen po'i mdzod spu ni mdzod spu kun no //
translated: The treasury of the great beings, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, is the ūrṇā, the curl of hair between the eyebrows.

original: de'i gnas ni thig le'i phyogs mdzod spu'i gnas su gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i gnas ni thig le'i phyogs mdzod spu'i gnas su gyur pa'o ;
translated: The place of that is the place of the ūrṇā, the side of the bindu.

original: / der yang dag par gnas pa ni de na gnas pa'o //🔽gang gi stobs kyis na mdzod spu thams cad kyi gnas su yang dag par gnas she na /
analyzed: / der yang dag par gnas pa ni de na gnas pa'o // gang gi stobs kyis na mdzod spu thams cad kyi gnas su yang dag par gnas she na /
translated: It is situated there, it abides there.🔽By whose power does it abide in the place of the ūrṇā?

original: ting 'dzin la ni rnam gzigs pas //
analyzed: ting 'dzin la ni rnam gzigs pas //
translated: By the power of the samādhi of the universal survey,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag po nyid //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug bdag po nyid //
translated: the Lord of the World is the master.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam @340b par dag pa'o zhes so sor rtog pa ni rnam par gzig pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam @340b par dag pa'o zhes so sor rtog pa ni rnam par gzig pas so //
translated: The universal survey is the discernment of all phenomena as pure by nature.

original: rnam par gzigs pa de las ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin nges par bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs pa de las ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin nges par bskyed pa'o //
translated: From that universal survey, the samādhi of emptiness is definitely generated.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las ni gtso bo 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid de des bdag por gyur pa nyid ni rigs thams cad kyi rgyal po nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las ni gtso bo 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid de des bdag por gyur pa nyid ni rigs thams cad kyi rgyal po nyid do //
translated: From that samadhi, the chief one is the Lord of the World himself, and his sovereignty is the kingship of all the clans.

original: de bas na 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid kyi bdag po nyid du gyur pas na bcom ldan 'das spyi gtsug kun gyi gnas na yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid kyi bdag po nyid du gyur pas na bcom ldan 'das spyi gtsug kun gyi gnas na yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since he is the Lord of the World himself, the Bhagavat is situated in the crest of the head of all.

original: der zhugs nas ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: der zhugs nas ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: Having entered there, what does he do?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He declares all the buddhas, etc.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o ;
translated: All the buddhas are Vairochana, etc.

original: / sras bcas ni byams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / sras bcas ni byams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sons are Maitreya, etc.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great vajra holders are Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang rdo rje 'chang chen po ni mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang rdo rje 'chang chen po ni mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: Such are all the buddhas and the great vajra holders, who are the best, the supreme.

original: rdo rje rin chen de yis ni phyag na gnas pa'i rdo rje rin chen des so //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen de yis ni phyag na gnas pa'i rdo rje rin chen des so //
translated: With that vajra jewel, which is situated in his hand, he, the Bhagavat, is the vajra holder.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges bar gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges bar gzung ba ste /
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of restriction.

original: rdo rje rin chen de nyid kyis so //🔽de tshe de la dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen de nyid kyis so // de tshe de la dbang bskur ro //
translated: By that very jewel-vajra.🔽At that time, he was consecrated.

original: zhes bya ba ni dus de'i tshe dbang bskur bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus de'i tshe dbang bskur bar gyur pa'o //
translated: At that time, he was consecrated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽Because of consecration by all lineages.

original: rigs kun gyis dbang bskur phyir dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te rigs kun ni nor bu'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: rigs kun gyis dbang bskur phyir dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te rigs kun ni nor bu'i rigs rnams so //
translated: All lineages are the lineages of the jewel.

original: de nas dbang bskur ba ni rigs kun gyis dbang bskur ba ste de'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba ni rigs kun gyis dbang bskur ba ste de'i 'og tu'o //
translated: Then, consecration is consecration by all lineages.🔽After that, he was born in the lineage of all the Tathāgatas, etc.,

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bor skyed par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bor skyed par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and was generated in the essence of the jewel lineage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rin po che'i rigs der skyes pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rin po che'i rigs der skyes pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of the Tathāgatas, etc., being born in that jewel lineage?

original: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to fulfill all wishes.

original: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i dngos grub la sred pa skye ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa thams cad de de yongs su rdzogs pa ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob bo //
analyzed: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i dngos grub la sred pa skye ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa thams cad de de yongs su rdzogs pa ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob bo //
translated: The arising of craving for the powers of the knowledge-holders and so forth is the thought of all those to be trained, and the complete fulfillment of that is the attainment of the powers of the knowledge-holders and so forth.

original: don de'i phyir dbang bskur ba des sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa thams cad dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dbang bskur zhing rin po che'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du mdzad pas na /
analyzed: don de'i phyir dbang bskur ba des sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa thams cad dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dbang bskur zhing rin po che'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du mdzad pas na /
translated: For that purpose, by that empowerment conferral, all the Buddhas together with their sons and Great Vajradhara, having made the nature of the jewel lineage,

original: kun mchog kun la dbang bskur nas //
analyzed: kun mchog kun la dbang bskur nas //
translated: having conferred the supreme of all,

original: shi sa par brjod pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: shi sa par brjod pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: spoke this declaration of good fortune.

original: zhes bya ba dang / aom sarba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / aom sarba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And they spoke the essence mantras beginning with “Oṃ sarva.”

original: de nas bzang po 'di @341a * //
analyzed: de nas bzang po 'di @341a * //
translated: Then, having spoken this good fortune,

original: gsungs shing // legs bar shis brjod dbang bskur bas //
analyzed: gsungs shing // legs bar shis brjod dbang bskur bas //
translated: the empowerment conferral of auspicious declarations,

original: zhes bya ba ni snying po 'di gsungs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la shis pa brjod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dbang bskur ba'i rgyud nas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying po 'di gsungs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la shis pa brjod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dbang bskur ba'i rgyud nas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: This is the empowerment conferred from the tantra of the empowerment, which has the nature of the benediction, immediately after the utterance of this essence.

original: rdo rje rin chen de las zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag na gnas pa de las so //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen de las zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag na gnas pa de las so //
translated: From that vajra jewel means from that which is held in the hand of the Blessed One Akashagarbha.

original: chos kyi gtso bo 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chos kyi gtso bo 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The chief of the Dharma will arise.

original: zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni chos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni chos so //
translated: The Dharma is discerning intuition.

original: de las byung ba dang de ston par byed pa dang / de thob par bya ba'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i sems dpa' ni chos kyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba dang de ston par byed pa dang / de thob par bya ba'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i sems dpa' ni chos kyi gtso bo ste /
translated: The chief of the Dharma is the spiritual hero who arises from that, who teaches that, and who confers the empowerment, etc. to attain that.

original: de dag snying po 'di gsungs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la de las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag snying po 'di gsungs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la de las byung ba yin no //
translated: They arise from that immediately after the utterance of this essence.

original: byung nas de rnams kyis ci zhig mdzad ce na byung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byung nas de rnams kyis ci zhig mdzad ce na byung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having arisen, what do they do?  Having arisen, etc. is stated.

original: chos kyi gtso bo de rnams ni rdo rje rin po che chen po de las byung nas 'gro ba sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad dang rin po che'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du bskyed par dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi gtso bo de rnams ni rdo rje rin po che chen po de las byung nas 'gro ba sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad dang rin po che'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du bskyed par dbang bskur ro //
translated: Those principal dharmas, having emerged from that great jewel vajra, empower all the realms of migrating beings to generate the nature of the jewel family.🔽How?

original: ji ltar zhe na ci rigs par ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ci rigs par ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “in whatever way is appropriate” is stated.

original: phyogs bcur rin po che'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor bskyed nas /
analyzed: phyogs bcur rin po che'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the maṇḍala of the jewel family in the ten directions,

original: de rnams dkyil 'khor du bcug pa'i cho gas bcug ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams dkyil 'khor du bcug pa'i cho gas bcug ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: they are caused to enter the maṇḍala through the rite of causing them to enter the maṇḍala. This is the meaning.

original: 'gro ba thams cad dbang bskur ba ji tsam gyis dbang bskur zhe na /🔽rdo rje kun gyi dbang bskur bas //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad dbang bskur ba ji tsam gyis dbang bskur zhe na / rdo rje kun gyi dbang bskur bas //
translated: By how much empowerment are all migrating beings empowered?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “empowerment of all vajras” is stated.

original: rdo rje kun ni 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa'i nor bu'i rigs kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje kun ni 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa'i nor bu'i rigs kyi lha rnams so //
translated: All vajras are the jewel family deities such as Ākāśagarbha.

original: de rnams kyi dbang bskur ba ni dbang bskur ba thams cad de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbang bskur ba ni dbang bskur ba thams cad de /
translated: Their empowerment is all empowerments.

original: de rnams rdzogs par bya ba nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams rdzogs par bya ba nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: They are perfected.

original: slar yang dkyil 'khor tshul gyis bzhugs //
analyzed: slar yang dkyil 'khor tshul gyis bzhugs //
translated: Again, they abide in the manner of a mandala.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar rdo rje rin po che de la sogs pa chos kyi gtso bo de rnams byung nas sems can gyi don mdzad de phyogs bcu nas slar byon te dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying pos bskor nas
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar rdo rje rin po che de la sogs pa chos kyi gtso bo de rnams byung nas sems can gyi don mdzad de phyogs bcu nas slar byon te dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying pos bskor nas
translated: Thus, those principal phenomena, such as the vajra jewel, having arisen and acted for the welfare of sentient beings, having returned from the ten directions, and having been surrounded by the mandala of the Bhagavat Noble Ākāśagarbha,

original: zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhugs pa yin no //
translated: they enter.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags spangs pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi don mdzad nas gti mug zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags spangs pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi don mdzad nas gti mug zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Vajrasattva, in the manner of a mandala of goddesses, having acted for the welfare of those to be trained who abandon desire through desire, he conquers delusion.

original: sems can gyi khams rnams la 'jig rten @341b dbang phyug tu gyur nas so sor rtog ba mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnams la 'jig rten @341b dbang phyug tu gyur nas so sor rtog ba mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Having become the Lord of the World for the realms of sentient beings, he makes distinctions.

original: de nas ser sna'i gnyen por gyur pa nor bu'i rigs ni nyi ma dang zla ba dang / skar ma'i gzugs can gyi nam mkhar gyur pa rdo rje rin chen bskyed de de las byang chub sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po'i skur zhugs nas de thams cad mdzad de rang gi snying po gsungs nas nyid kyi phyag na gnas pa'i rdo rje rin po
analyzed: de nas ser sna'i gnyen por gyur pa nor bu'i rigs ni nyi ma dang zla ba dang / skar ma'i gzugs can gyi nam mkhar gyur pa rdo rje rin chen bskyed de de las byang chub sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po'i skur zhugs nas de thams cad mdzad de rang gi snying po gsungs nas nyid kyi phyag na gnas pa'i rdo rje rin po
translated: Then, for the antidote to miserliness, the jewel family is generated as the vajra jewel in the space of the form of the sun, moon, and stars, and the great bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha enters his form and performs all those deeds.

original: che las rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i ngo bor gyur nas nges sems can gyi khams thams cad nor bu'i rigs su bcug nas /
analyzed: che las rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i ngo bor gyur nas nges sems can gyi khams thams cad nor bu'i rigs su bcug nas /
translated: Having uttered his essence mantra, the vajra jewel that resides in his hand becomes the nature of all the deities of his maṇḍala and enters the realm of all sentient beings as the jewel family.

original: nor bu'i rigs las nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du mdzad nas slar byung ste /
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs las nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du mdzad nas slar byung ste /
translated: Having made the nature of the jewel family from the jewel family, it emerges again.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thig le'i gnas su bzhugs nas de thams cad mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thig le'i gnas su bzhugs nas de thams cad mdzad do //
translated: Having resided in the place of the bindu of all tathāgatas, it performs all those deeds.

original: yang nor bu'i rigs kyi lha'i tshul gyis phyogs bcu nas byon pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang nor bu'i rigs kyi lha'i tshul gyis phyogs bcu nas byon pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: Or else, in the manner of the jewel family deities, they come from the ten directions and abide in the form of a mandala.

original: de ltar de nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar de nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with “then”,

original: dkyil 'khor gyis kyang bzhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyis kyang bzhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to “abide in the form of a mandala”, this explanation teaches the second meditative stabilization.

original: de nas bsdu ba sngon du 'gro ba ni gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsdu ba sngon du 'gro ba ni gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should understand that the third [meditative stabilization] is preceded by the gathering.

original: de ltar nor bu'i rigs kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar nor bu'i rigs kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the three meditative stabilizations of the jewel family,

original: da ni dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams kyis bzlas brjod dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir //🔽bde gshegs kun gyis byin brlabs pas //
analyzed: da ni dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams kyis bzlas brjod dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir // bde gshegs kun gyis byin brlabs pas //
translated: now, in order to teach the ritual for those who have obtained the commitments and initiation, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Recite and meditate”, and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i las kyi cho ga rgyas pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i las kyi cho ga rgyas pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The extensive ritual for the master’s acts and the acts for inducting the disciples, and so forth, are taught, beginning with “Blessed by all the Sugatas”.

original: rdo rje rin chen zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin chen 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rdo rje rin chen gyis nye bar mtshan pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje rin chen ni 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin chen 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rdo rje rin chen gyis nye bar mtshan pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje rin chen ni 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: The one called Vajraratna is noble Akashagarbha, because he is the cause of the emergence of Vajraratna and is characterized by Vajraratna.

original: 'di'i gong na mchog tu gyur pa gzhan med pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gong na mchog tu gyur pa gzhan med pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: He is unsurpassed because there is no one higher than him.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The Blessed One, noble Akashagarbha, is blessed by all Tathagatas.

original: rtog pa de gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa de gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He is the one who speaks this discourse.

original: rtog pa de gsungs pa gang yin na rtog pa 'di'i las ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa de gsungs pa gang yin na rtog pa 'di'i las ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this discourse that he speaks? What is the function of this discourse?

original: shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says very and so on.

original: shin tu zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: Very means beginningless and endless.

original: dbang phyug kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dbang phyug chen po ste khams @342a * //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dbang phyug chen po ste khams @342a * //
translated: He is Mahesvara because he is the lord of the great elements.

original: gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal po nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal po nor bu'i rigs kyi rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The third is Vajradhara, who is of the nature of the jewel family, the king of Dharma.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: He is Mahesvara, because he is of that nature.

original: shin tu yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na shin tu dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na shin tu dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: He is Mahamahesvara, because he is very much so.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni dngos grub mchog ste /
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni dngos grub mchog ste /
translated: His perfection is the supreme attainment.

original: de stsol bar mdzad pas na shin tu dbang phyug chen po'i dngos grub mchog stsol to //
analyzed: de stsol bar mdzad pas na shin tu dbang phyug chen po'i dngos grub mchog stsol to //
translated: He is the bestower of the supreme attainment of Mahamahesvara, because he bestows it.

original: nor bu'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sgrub pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sgrub pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought of the jewel family is called the thought of the accomplishment of the mandala, etc., and of the object of attainment.

original: de gsungs pa ni rtog pa de bka' stsal ba'o //
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni rtog pa de bka' stsal ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is the teaching of that thought.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa' phyi'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa' phyi'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The great mandala is the outer mandala of Vajrasattva.

original: gang gi phyi rol de dang 'dra ba de phyi'i dkyil 'khor chen po ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyi rol de dang 'dra ba de phyi'i dkyil 'khor chen po ste zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is outside of it is like it, and so it is called the great outer mandala.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung pa ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung pa ste /
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: phyi rol ni dkyil 'khor chen po dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol ni dkyil 'khor chen po dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: The external is just like the great maṇḍala.

original: nam mkha'i 'khor lor zhes bya ba nang gi dkyil 'khor chen po nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la nor bu'i dbyibs zur brgyad pa dang 'dra bar 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'khor lor zhes bya ba nang gi dkyil 'khor chen po nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la nor bu'i dbyibs zur brgyad pa dang 'dra bar 'dug pa'o //
translated: The “wheel of space” is the great inner maṇḍala, which is like space, and is situated like the shape of an eight-faceted gem.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i mdog can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i mdog can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be “the color of space,” and so on.

original: nam mkha'i mdog ni bee d'urya'i mdog ste mdog sngon po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mdog ni bee d'urya'i mdog ste mdog sngon po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The “color of space” is the color of beryl, which means the color blue.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis so //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis so //
translated: “The sun and moon” are the sun maṇḍala and the moon maṇḍala.

original: skar ma dang gza' rnams kyis brgyan par bri zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i ngos la shar zhing 'jig rten na grags pa'i skar ma dang gza' rnams kyis kyang brgyan cing mdzes par bya ba'i nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor de yang dag par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: skar ma dang gza' rnams kyis brgyan par bri zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i ngos la shar zhing 'jig rten na grags pa'i skar ma dang gza' rnams kyis kyang brgyan cing mdzes par bya ba'i nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor de yang dag par bri bar bya'o //
translated: “Adorned with the stars and planets” means that the space maṇḍala should be drawn adorned and beautified by the stars and planets that appear in the sky and are known in the world.

original: de'i dbus zhes bya ba ni dbus ni dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus zhes bya ba ni dbus ni dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba'i dbus su'o //
translated: In its center means in the center of the mandala.

original: nam mkha'i snying po ni zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nam mkha' snying po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po ni zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nam mkha' snying po'o //
translated: Akashgarbha means the noble Akashagarbha.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste nam mkha'i snying po nyid do //🔽bdag nyid thams cad dgyes par gzhag / ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na bdag nyid thams cad de /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste nam mkha'i snying po nyid do // bdag nyid thams cad dgyes par gzhag / ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na bdag nyid thams cad de /
translated: The word “only” means that it is Akashagarbha alone.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i sku thams cad do //🔽de la dgyes pa ni yid bde ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid thams cad dgyes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i sku thams cad do // de la dgyes pa ni yid bde ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid thams cad dgyes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should place oneself in the joy of all means that one should place oneself in the joy of the entire body of the Lord, the noble Akashagarbha.🔽Joy is the possession of mental pleasure.

original: de gzhag cing dgod par bya'o //🔽dag pa'i bee d'urya'i mdog @342b 'dra ba //
analyzed: de gzhag cing dgod par bya'o // dag pa'i bee d'urya'i mdog @342b 'dra ba //
translated: One should place oneself in that, one should establish oneself in that.🔽The color of pure beryl

original: zhes bya ba ni rin po che bee d'urya nag nog gi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba ni dag pa'i bee d'urya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin po che bee d'urya nag nog gi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba ni dag pa'i bee d'urya ste /
translated: means that a beryl gem free from all the stains of impurity is a pure beryl.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i mdog 'di la mngal bas na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i mdog 'di la mngal bas na /
translated: Because he is endowed with this color,

original: dag pa'i bee d'urya yi mdog 'dra ba //
analyzed: dag pa'i bee d'urya yi mdog 'dra ba //
translated: he is the color of pure beryl.

original: zhes bya'o // yang /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yang /
translated: And also,

original: de yi 'od zer 'bar ba sna tshogs 'khug / ces bya ste /
analyzed: de yi 'od zer 'bar ba sna tshogs 'khug / ces bya ste /
translated: his blazing light-rays swirl in various ways.

original: gang gi 'od zer kha dog sna lnga pas sna tshogs de nyid kun du 'brug cing phan tshun khyab par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'od zer kha dog sna lnga pas sna tshogs de nyid kun du 'brug cing phan tshun khyab par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because his light-rays are of five colors, they swirl in various ways, and they mutually pervade each other. He who is so is called that.

original: yang de nyid /🔽g-yon pas rin chen thugs kar stod //🔽ces bya ba phyag g-yon pas rdo rje rin chen gyi thugs ka'i phyogs su stod pa'i tshul gyis bsnams pa 'di la mnga' bas na /
analyzed: yang de nyid / g-yon pas rin chen thugs kar stod // ces bya ba phyag g-yon pas rdo rje rin chen gyi thugs ka'i phyogs su stod pa'i tshul gyis bsnams pa 'di la mnga' bas na /
translated: And also,🔽he holds a jewel to his heart with his left hand.

original: g-yon pas rin chen thugs kar stod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yon pas rin chen thugs kar stod // ces bya ba la /
translated: He who holds a vajra-jewel to his heart with his left hand is called that.

original: g-yas pas nor chen rab stsol ba //
analyzed: g-yas pas nor chen rab stsol ba //
translated: He holds a great jewel in his right hand.

original: zhes bya ba de phyag g-yas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che la sogs pa'i nor bu rin po la sogs pa'i nor 'dod pa rnams la nam mkha'i khyab pa'i nor stsol ba 'di la mnga' bas na de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba de phyag g-yas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che la sogs pa'i nor bu rin po la sogs pa'i nor 'dod pa rnams la nam mkha'i khyab pa'i nor stsol ba 'di la mnga' bas na de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: The right hand of that one bestows the wish-granting jewel, etc. , and the jewels, wealth, and so on, desired by those who pervade the sky with wealth. It is called that one because of the mastery of this.

original: / de'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: / de'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: The one called that is Akashagarbha.

original: ngos zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad du'o //
analyzed: ngos zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad du'o //
translated: The side is all directions.

original: sems can mchog ces bya ba ni sems dpa'i dam pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can mchog ces bya ba ni sems dpa'i dam pa yin no //
translated: The supreme being is the best of beings.

original: bzhi po gzungs bcas dam pa zhes bya ba ni sems dpa' mchog bzhi po rang gi rig pa'i lha mo dang bcas pa dam par gyur cing phul du byung ba dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi po gzungs bcas dam pa zhes bya ba ni sems dpa' mchog bzhi po rang gi rig pa'i lha mo dang bcas pa dam par gyur cing phul du byung ba dgod par bya'o //
translated: The four best ones together with the dhāraṇīs are to be placed as the best and most excellent, together with their own knowledge goddesses.

original: dbang bskur ba dang zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: The consecration, etc. , are easy to understand.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis ni //
